description: I knew it would be a great time before we even got there! As soon as I saw the google maps review I called an Uber and met my friends at Shanghai Kelly's for a bday party. Was not disappointed!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Never went in so no judgments about the service or atmosphere but I find the name to be in poor taste as it appears to be a tribute to a kidnapper.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Kelly_(crimper)
author: Steve N.

description: Awesome bar with a very laid back vibe. Aaron was awesome and kept up with the busy crowd. Jukebox for music and a few tv's.
author: Dana N.

description: I had the worst case of the hiccups at this bar and the bouncer went above and beyond to get me a lemon wedge dipped in bitters which cured them immediately. I had never heard of this trick before and am very pleased that they showed me. I'm also a Steelers fan so I would give them 5 stars anyway.
author: miranda b.

description: Definitely my fave dive bar in this area! I just got back from 4 nights in San Fran and we found ourselves at this bar every single night of the trip LOL. Good vibes, good staff, good music, good drinks- We all agreed it was definitely a highlight of our trip.
author: Valerie R.

description: If you like grunge, if you like divey, you'll like this joint. Come with low expectations and they will be met. It's everything you thought it would be and less.
author: Steven D.

description: Thank god for this bar! Comfortable environment and good people, plus they had Miller Lite and Fireball for my girl, so definitely a good thing. Good ol' tavern feel.
author: Parker L.

description: Shanghai Kelly's is a great spot to stop in on a Sunday afternoon to watch some games and enjoy good company.  The bar is small with only a tiny booth in the back so it is usually standing room only, or sitting on the ledge where the windows are.  The bartenders are friendly and no b.s. I've seen them appropriately cut off people who are way too drunk from a long Sunday funday and the staff is good at handling a (at times) rowdy crowd in here.  The drunks are about $5.50 for a nice draft (lagunitas).  This is the perfect no frills bar that is always a good time and a stop along the way while bar hoping on Polk street.
author: Kelsey B.

description: If its St. Patrick's day there is no bar more popular. I vividly remember the bars on that day and this one was happening. On an average night it is good unpretentious fun. Very casual and comfortable. Its a dive but people are happy here. You can be loud, be yourself and not worry about anything. Isn't that a big part about what a bar is all about? Its not very large but a good place to watch the game Sunday afternoon.
author: Stefan T.

description: Definitely a dive bar. But at that its a pretty fun place. I like Shanghai Kelly's because you never know what their drunk special is going to be, and because the drinks are pretty cheap for being in San Francisco. It is also conveniently located to all the other bars on Polk, so you can walk to all the other bars.
author: Ross S.

description:
The WORST experience ive had since moving to Russian Hill. 

Sure it was the owner behind thr bar too. Old chubby bald guy completely ignored me multille times.

Got here before my buddies to watch game on Sunday. Went to bar waited for bartender to stop flirting with these girls. Walked to my side of bar asked if everyone was all good, i raised hand to order drink, made eye contact gave me thumbs up nd wlked away.  See him walk back and refilll girls drinks. Walked back again made eye contact, this time he ignored completely me must be a frekin racist or something. Ignored me again while taking a beer order from customer standing left of me and never acknowledged me or even check my ID.

Shook my head and walked out. Called friends and spent hundreds of dollars down the street. 

I sure hope hes not the owner. Will never go back as long as hes there and will tell all my friends same thing. Place is a joke
author: Jesse S.

description:
I thought this place was named after a feen named Kelly who had a thing for China.  Word on the streets is Kelly was a red headed Irish man with a temper who basically "ruffied" sailors to get them to do work on ships sailing to far away lands.  "King of the Crimps" he was. Dastardly antics but not illegal in the 1800s.  Anywho.... 

A great neighborhood bar and I am lucky to have a friend who is a "neighbor" who took us here.  Divey, laid back, sporty, and cheap drinks!  It's not huge but there were plenty of  seats...magic I guess.  Also, there were enough TV's so that you can see and keep up with whatever is on at the time from any place in the bar.  

I had the pleasure of meeting one of the bartenders, Dave.  He served me the  "Champagne of Beer".  He asked if I wanted another at the perfect time, two sips before empty.  I didn't meet the other bartender but he was wearing a FC Barcelona jersey and jacket so he is fine by me!

Overall, this bar has a Cheers like feel and is a nice spot to have a drink day or night.
author: Melissa R.

description:
it's a fun little bar near my old house. they sponsor my softball team so we go here after games... cheap drinks & a fun sports atmosphere. cool little bar with no frills, def check it out

side note - this place gets CRAZY for St.Patty's Day !
author: danielle a.

description: BEST STEELERS BAR!  I yelped to find the best Steelers bar in the city for the AFC Wildcard game and we were in SF, and we stumbled upon this bar.  We also asked a few bartenders around town and they all agreed we should try this bar.  We are so glad we did.  The bartender Greg was awesome and knew everyone in the place.  The service was fast and efficient, the drinks were great.  No food but you can bring some in.  When we left, they thanked us by name and everyone in the bar was friendly.  Definitely a bar to check out!
author: Tracy W.

description:
Shanghai Kelly was a mystery. why  i came here. no doubt it was a change of pace from the much frequented chinatown bars. no doubt my friends introduced me to this place.  

probably discovered cocktais here as chinatown bars wasn't proficient in them.
author: Victor G.

description: It's my ALL TIME FAVORITE BAR in San Francisco.  I started going here 30 + years ago (and even had part of my bachelorette party there)!  I always feel right at home when I go to Shanghai's and even feel 30 years younger sitting on those barstools! You might stop in for one drink, but guarantee you will stay and enjoy your night there! Can't wait for my next trip to San Francisco!
author: Marianne F.

description: Such a terrible dive bar or sports bar or whatever you call it. Place literally can only fit 20 people but was packed with way way way more. I don't know why people enjoy these kinds of situations but I like to walk out feeling just as clean and sane as I was before I entered thank you very much. Drinks weren't that bad but I could hardly focus on my company because of how ratch the place was.
author: Lucy C.

description: I went to this place one time for a drink. Quick service and peaceful place. Would go again if around the area.
author: C G.

description: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this bar after leaving the overly crowded Warf. It was my first visit to San Francisco and I was over the tourist stuff and just wanted to go to a real place and we found it. The drinks were good and the bartender was super nice. This bar has a lot of character and we will definitely return on our next visit.
author: Brittany C.

description:
This bar is an easy go to bar for me. Maybe it is because I pretty much know at least one person in there whenever I walk in whether it is staff or people there drinking.
The place is pretty spacious for a bar on Polk st. and there is usually room up at the bar.
My only hate of this place is the restroom. I don't know why but I seriously can't stand it. I always seems to be dirty, it could just be that it is so old that it looks dirty even when its clean but I just get claustrophobic in there.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
It's been awhile since I've been to this cool spot at the north peak of Polk, at Broadway. It's a great starting point for what could be an epic bar crawl down Polk Street...if you ever leave, actually.
Great local crowd, kick ass bartender, and a nice touch of local flavor. When you're situated that close to Van Ness, Broadway and Polk, the neighborhood mentally ill will generally find your door, offering varying bits of useful and/or puzzling information. The staff is firm but friendly, and its a minor distraction for a generally fun and friendly crowd of locals.
The bar is eclectically appointed with a few interesting pieces of art (I'm not talking patrons!), with a dark bar top and a great glass front along Broadway. Comfortable is how I'd describe this bar. Stop on in, have a few, and get Shanghai'd.
author: Jesse M.

description: divey bar, but cool atmosphere. was here for a warriors game and had a great time. clientele is very enthusiastic for sure!
author: Christina L.

description: Ok, so there are several reasons i really like this place.  First and foremost, it's a Steelers bar.  That in of itself would do it for me.  Add to that great beer selection and good pricing.  They also throw lots of parties and fun events.  The only minor issue is that it's a small place and it can get crowded and warm at times.  HOWEVER, that's so much better than an empty boring bar ;-)
author: Greta R.

description: I've never had a worse experience than at this bar. The bouncer quested my ID even though I am 26 and I have a legit California ID. The beer I received wasn't cold and they didn't offer me a new one once I brought up that the temperature wasn't right. All the TVs are very outdated and super cramped inside there. The only reason this place is in business is because it has great location on Polk Street.
author: Bobby A.

description:
It's nothing fancy, but I'm a fan of a laid-back dive-ish place to hang with friends and have a beer. It got a little crowded while I was there, but I took that as a good sign (I'd much rather it be a little crowded than deserted). I was there with some locals, and it seemed like their own personal version of Cheers, which was pretty cool. 

Plus, they have a pear cider on tap that was pretty awesome, so that in and of itself earned Shanghai Kelly's a star. I'd definitely go back again next time I visit.
author: Laura G.

description:
bottom line: unique name, unique vibe

came here to catch a warriors playoff game after stopping by a few other very-full bars down the street. this place was great! we got drinks rather quickly and were able to snag a table for our group. a fair number of TVs and lots of local flavor and memorabilia on the walls. my main complaint is that some of the TVs were placed in awkward locations, causing some of us to crane our necks in order to watch the game.
author: Aaron T.

description:
"I don't really remember much about this bar, but..." seems to be what many say when talking about Shanghai Kelly's on Polk Street. That's appropriate, given the pub is named after a notorious asshole of San Francisco history who would "shanghai" sailors into service by drugging them and selling them to captains.

And then you wake up still drunk in the morning at someone else's place.

Yup, sounds about right.

I don't remember much about Shanghai Kelly's myself, except that the one time I was there, I had a fairly good time. It wasn't packed and the service was good. Normally, however, I steer clear from this spot as it's usually full of bros.
author: Keane L.

description:
We needed to find a spot to watch the 49ers game and happened upon Shanghai Kelly's.  Yep, it's a dive bar, but a fun one at that.  At least 1/3 of the patrons were locals. The bar not only supports the 49ers but also the Steelers.  For some reason all the women were given large slices of cheesecake when we were there.

1 booth in the back, space for about 15 at the bar, 1 high top, and stools for another 20 people.  2 big screen TV and maybe another 4-5 smaller TVs.  
 
Beers on tap range from Coors Light, Fat Tire, Sierra Nevada, Guinness, to Lagunitas IPA and a Cider.  $4-6/pint. $15 minimum charge for credit cards, but you can run a tab.

Food: N/A
P/C: 4.5
Service: 4 (come'on, it's a dive bar, but friendly!)
author: Steve T.

description: This place sucks. Universal sign for "I want a drink" is to place money infront of you. Bar tender ignored me for a good 15 minutes. This was after I tipped him pretty well too. Not saying it entitles me to extras or free drinks, but come on, at least take a hint.
author: Daniel-san F.

description:
The bartenders here are characters. Straight-shooters, who will make you smile with their forward humor, while refilling your water glass on the regular.

Shanghai Kelly's on a weekday around 7:30pm is a great spot to catch up with someone. The music - like the bartenders - is mellow and solid. It doesn't try too hard. It just is. On a mellow Monday - you may find yourself in here - with just a small handful of others. 

You can tell that Shanghai Kelly's is a regular spot for many. It just feels like it. The soft yellow lighting, and endearing Irish bartender have a unique way of putting you at ease.

I've only been here on quiet week-days so I can't comment on what Shanghai Kelly's is like on rowdy game nights or weekends, but I'm a fan of this place for the below reasons:

I never had to ask for water refills.

I dug their diverse music selection.

There was no wait for a clean bathroom.

That is all.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

Small, divey bar with great pours and cold beers. Friendly staff that always takes care of me.  A great place to head after work or earlier on the weekends (before all the young kids take over). I love coming here, because you can always strike up a fun convo with the folks here, while watching a bunch of sports.
I have lived in SF for 10 years, and bartended here for 7 of them, and I have to say, this is one of the best bars in the city.
author: Gram G.

description:
There's nothing Chinese about it. 
Or Irish, either. 
So I'm confused as to why its called "Shanghai Kelly's. 
But I went there for St. Patricks Day
and I'm Scottish...
so I was already all kinds of confused as it was.
But I liked it.
Which is perhaps most confusing of all.
author: Emily D.

description:
Shanghai Kelly earns kudos to me and I wish there was a saloon in Alameda just like it . The bar is small but homey and the locals seem well established meaning they were not going to leave their stools for quite sometime. I like the fact that there are window stools so you can view the Broadway & Polk intersection and see the foot traffic.

The gf was at her hairdressers and I had some time to kill on a Sunday afternoon. After a quick stroll to Lombardi's Sport store I strolled down Polk looking for a place to sit my country ass down. I saw one sports bar and it was filled with patrons wearing Steeler's uniforms - hostile environment I thought. I went back the other direction, strolled in, sat in between an older gentleman and a two lively ladies and ordered a beer. The bartender with the Mets baseball cap was very attentive with my order. 

With three screens on side of the room and two on the other I was in football heaven. Shanghai Kelly's offers a well stocked bar, 10 different beers on tap and enough shot glasses to cover those cheering on the Raiders whoop those Chargers. Another round of shots please!!
author: Jim D.

description:
This is a classic dive bar and Steelers bar. Came on a Wednesday and they had a beer special of $2.50 for Miller Lite drafts. Not too shabby. Lots of locals/regulars in their respective groups having a good time. It is a small place with TVs in every direction.

When the place is packed, service can be slow at times due to their limited staff. Everyone is friendly though and all in all, this is a good place to hang out with friends!
author: Steve V.

description: Standard dive bar -- staff is quite friendly, including the doorman. Drinks are also inexpensive. Would come again!
author: Siv L.

description: Really nice bartenders, good drinks, great sports bar to watch games in! Was only visiting and felt right at home like a local.
author: Tyler P.

description: Coming here is never on our initial agenda but it's a chill spot that it easy to get to, easy to find, and thus an easy spot to meet up with friends after whatever it is that we were doing before.
author: Loli L.

description: Great little bar on Polk Street. It's small, so it can get crowded, but the bartenders are nice and the drinks are resonable. Win win in my book.
author: Jane F.

description: went to watch the warriors game on wednesday and it was a great spot to watch the game. its cozy and the people are really nice. they also let us bring in food (nicks across the street) to eat while watching the game- super cool. drinks are also cheap. its on the smaller side, but that is obvious so if you want a bigger bar- go somewhere else. i will come back here!
author: Kam L.

description: Thank you Cass for the awesome drink!!! Awesome atmosphere with friendly people and affordable drinks!!!
author: Jenn R.

description:
You've seen cheers right? This is that...but better.

This place is great. It's people are even better.
author: Shauna C.

description: This is a small, non-descript dive bar in my 'hood, and my pals and I used to drop by occasionally for a beer or three. That is until I was harassed by one of the staff while walking my dog past it the other morning. As my five pound rescue pup marked its territory (which it does about 100 times per day) on the building where the bar is, an employee charged out and berated me for daring to let him lift his leg near the outside of the bar. As I walked by in the other direction, I could see him standing near the window, glaring at the passers by, waiting to pop out jack-in-the-box style at his next victim. Hard to imagine a better way to damage your business.
author: Nick C.

description:
I heart Shanghai's! They are the sister bar to Northstar Cafe in North Beach. 

All the staff are amazing! Dave, Greg, Brian, Cass, Mark to name a few! Great crowd and super blue Coors Light mountains :)

Love it here for football on Sundays, I'm a Niner fan and so are some of the bartenders but the bar itself is a Steelers bar.

Ladies-The bathroom is totally decent! Gents-Take a look at the pics above the toilet! To die for!
author: Amanda S.

description: My friend and I stopped in to Shanghai Kellys after attending a San Francisco Firefighters fund raiser.  We were seated at the bar, there were 4 others at the bar also.  The batender totally ignored us.  Never onces acknowledged our presents. We  waited till he made several drinks for others, still no greeting from him. It became blantant that we were not going to be served.  There were no signs posted stating who they serve and who they dont serve.  We were the only Blacks in there. Could that have been the reason?
author: Jean G.

description: Casual, low key sports bar that's easy to find. Chill customers and an awesome bartender makes for a great spot for a couple of drinks. There was still room at the bar and a couple of empty tables when I went. I loved that this place doesn't get as crowded as others on Polk.
author: Winnie T.

description:
Your typical dive bar, nothing special. Good selection of beers and drinks at a decent price, lots of personality to the decor. 

When I walked in I was immediately swallowed by the crowd. My group tried to hang out near the wall but I was constantly jostled all night. And considering the majority of the crowd there.. I often felt like I was on some West Coast version of the Jersey Shore. I probably won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: Ziyan C.

description: The bartender there was very cool. Can't remember his name. A really cool Irish or English guy... sorry been a little while since I stopped in. The place was empty, but he was friendly and helpful and was hanging out and talking to us and the one other guy there. I had a great experience in SF and this place was a great stop before head back to our room.
author: Florence L.

description: Our first stop and the check in for our brawl crawl. IT was really standing room only because it was the very first stop. I tried their special shot which I and all my friends agreed was totally watered down all sugar shot. Then I have a vodka lemonade. Which the bartender had a very heavy hand and was mostly vodka! He also like my friends cruella costume he hooked us up with free shot, WIN! All in all this bar was just a nice local sports bar with fast-ish service
author: Desiree Y.

description: I came here all the time when I was a drunk idiot. I went in there half sober and almost threw up from the bathroom stinking up the whole bar.
author: Lloyed C.

description:
I love this bar, the best times to come are during the day before it starts to get packed with too many meat heads there to watch sports and scream at each other. 
My husband has been rocking a Shanghai Kelly's hat for a couple years, he always gets a free drink when we go in :) 
I believe you can find this info on their website, but be sure to read the story about the name of the bar, pretty interesting.
Also, there's a sign right outside the bar that's hilarious; you must check it out.
author: Roxanne R.

description: This is a Pittsburg bar in SF. Douchebags and assholes galore. Owners=great. Patrons=shit. One does beg the question, why the hell would anyone want a Pittsburg bar outside of Pittsburgh? That city is horrible and so are the people. Yea, don't go here.
author: Carl C.

description: I wanted to really like this place, but both the Fat Tire and the Guinness had a strange taste.  Either they need to clean their lines or clean their glasses better or both.  And all their bottle beer was crap.
author: Daniel W.

description:
If you can ever rate a place based on how many people are in it, this place gets a 5 star rating. If you don't like a ton of people around you, people bumping your drinks and people fondling you and your date, this is not the place for you. 
Having said that, if you ever find me there, it doesn't necessarily mean I am there because I love how crowded it is or that I want some one to fondle me or my date. Well, maybe me, never my date. ;)

This place rocks! Great crew, great strong beverages and fun atmosphere!! I've been 3 times now and I look forward to the time I get to go back. Super low budge, but great value!

Thanks Kelly's! 
P.S. And yes, if you're not a Steeler fan, you can still go! Shhhhh, I ever stepped in as a Laker fan...Whoah Nelly!
author: Brad G.

description: Probably the worst bar I've ever been to. And apparently they like to hire really douchy guys who are not bouncers to work the door. Because they can't do their job these guys get upset and overreact when people aren't out by 2:15 am. I wouldn't go here and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
author: Jasmine S.

description: Awesome Steelers bar! This is the best Steelers bar I've ever been to! Everyone here is friendly and high five each other! And they're open before 10am on Sundays NOT 1pm. Only downside is no food service. But don't fret, you're allowed to bring outside food here surprisingly. So I normally just grab a slice down the street and bring it back to eat during half time. Parking has never been an issue.
author: Max F.

description: Casual, low-key place with nice people and an awesome bartender.  Hockey on the TVs.  Winner.
author: Jess H.

description: Just your random dive bar? No. Clayton made this out of towner feel like a friend. He bought us a round and told us where we should go to finish off the evening. Such a solid character. They don't have food but allow you to bring it in. Two hours were never better spent!
author: Katie B.

description:
Even though only a few blocks away, we've avoided this 
place because it's too packed and noisy.
Happened to stop in for a round last saturday  during the early 
evening just as the Giants fans were streaming in for the game. 
The bartenders are fun. Great personalities, this is truly a locals
spot. The patrons were a mix of older groups, families, and young
couples from the neighborhood like ourselves. I'm not a huge fan of 
kids in a bar especially a narrow and crowded bar. Must Try: John Daly!
-sweet tea vodka & odwalla lemonade. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
Because of my lack of bar-hoppin' and reviews from bars, I can tell you one thing, that I'm probably the last Yelper to give a useful review to any bars. 

Like the preceeding reviews from other Yelpers, this small corner bar is definitely a bar for Pittsburgh Steeler's Fans. I don't know how this small bar can hold all these fans .i.e. my co-worker and his wife who are also die-hard Pittsburgh Steeler's fan. And me, a Niner fan, well, I'm just hiding shamefully and just there to watch and enjoying the game. I'm not going to tell the Steeler fans that i'm a Niner fan. I'm not that crazy!

The bar offers $2.00 bottles of Bud and Bud Light. It is kind of odd offering the excited Steeler fans a special on a crappy St. Louis beer. Anyway, the sport-patrons drink whatever they can to enjoy the playoff game. 

Despite a sad and painful ending to Ravens Running Back Willis McGahee, the Steelers won the game and advance to Superbowl versus the NFC Champion: Arizona Cardinals. And all the Steeler fans including my two companions were very thrilled, happy and most likely be back to Shanghai Kelly's for the Superbowl.
author: Matt G.

description:
Likes: nice to hang out with peeps, jukebox, TVs, high tables and stools, small place

Dislikes:
author: Karen M.

description: Fun vibe, great crowd, cheap drinks. Been here several times with my gfs and always had a good time.  It is one of our to go bars if Bullitt is super crowded. Hehehhe!
author: Claudine V.

description: Fun spot on the corner with friendly staff. I would stop in again if I come back to town.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Take everything wonderful upper Polk street has to offer, concentrate it, presto.

Bros in blue shirts and tan pants, ball caps.  Girls in open-toed shoes and 7 jeans.  TV's, top 40.  Jesus, I'm falling asleep writing this.
author: Ryan P.

description: Great bar.  Good drinks, fun crowd.  Thanks Mr. Shanghai for a fun night.
author: Brenda G.

description:
Cool little bar with a real neighborhood type vibe to it. The bartender noticed that it was my first time in there and started asking if I was new to the neighborhood, etc. Real friendly guy, chatted with him awhile and he even bought me a shot (thanks bruv)! 

It's kinda far from my place so I haven't been back since the first time I went (the night I ended up there I was out on a walk to clear my head, long story). To be honest I don't really think I'd go out of my way to frequent the place, but if I was ever in the area and feeling a little thirsty for a good stiff drink, I wouldn't hesitate to stop in. I suggest you do the same!
author: Tommy P.

description: Fantastic place - perfect for a mellow drink or a rowdy BC game.
author: Braunson C.

description:
I had the best time here last night.

#1 - Because the FL Gators won the National Championship
#2 - Steve and Dave served it up right and didnt get mad that I kept calling Dave, Doug.

This bar really is everything you need, great bartenders, open at all the right times, and the girls restroom isnt anything to right home about, but it does the trick. 

Polk Street offers alot of choices, but I keep coming back here, it 's just a sure thing, and a sure thing can be hard to find these days!
author: Alicia K.

description:
I was pumped when I found this bar.  I've only been in SF for two months, and I have been looking for a chill bar to hangout, watch sports, and drink.  
The drinks were good.  They have a John Daly drink that is great.
The music is pretty good as it comes from a jukebox, and it seemed like the people using it had good taste.  Both bartenders seem like good dudes.  Certainly going back, and I can see it becoming my go-to bar, for sure.
author: Stuart V.

description:
Great Steelers' bar! :)

I've been to Shanghai Kelly's for the last 2 Steeler Superbowls and both times the place is packed! The place definitely get packed when the Steelers are playing.

I will be back next season! :)
author: Grace C.

description:
I live down the street and still don't go there that much. It has a good sports crowd if you like the Steelers and the local teams, but even then it is insanely crowded due to how small it is. 

I don't recall the drinks being outrageously expensive but there's nothing about it that screams "come back".

Parking is IMPOSSIBLE in my neighborhood. 

If you get desperate you can pay for parking across the street at walgreen's.

DO NOT test your parking luck. It will not happen, especially after 5pm.
author: Carlos A.

description: It's a dive bar.  All I need to have fun is one semi-decent IPA option and funny shit on the walls.  Success.
author: James S.

description:
These are good people.

I love these guys, they are always up for a party, drink, jab, memory or a laugh. 

What an institution... I went to Shanghai Kelly's for the first time in 1994 with a Deputy from 850 Bryant... He told me it was a good bar.  I had no idea in '94 how much staying power it had, and has. 

I recommend sitting at the bar in the back, watching the day or night go by.  You can talk to anyone in there... bartenders, patrons, yourself... it don't matter.  They like you. 

 It looks the same still as I hope it will always remain so divey, so comfy, so available, so yeaaah,,,

Thanks guys
author: Kerstin A.

description:
Standard.  Crowded on Thursday-Sunday nights.  Typical crowd, typical bouncers.  I've had a few negative experiences with the bouncers where they just treated us with a hostile attitude.  Uncool.  They do, however, have a very friendly and nice female bartender - not sure of her name. 

If you're into the Marina-encroaching atmosphere of loudness, drunkenness, and popped-collars, then this is your place - they do a good job of catering to that crowd.

If you're more like me, you visit this place when you have friends in town looking for a party night, or if you need to catch a game that's not included in your cable package.  This place serves its purpose, but that purpose is not something I really want a part of.
author: Nick B.

description:
Darie, one of the bartenders, is a friend. So I have to automatically give this place a 5 stars. I'm not a "sports bar person". I only really go to meet friends or to stop by and say hello. But its a great hole in the way local pub type of place. My first time was probably the most awkward moment in my life. I went in looking for my date (my boyfriend now but whom I met for the first time...sober). Myself being a tiny asian girl would probably stick out like a sore thumb and bring questions as to how I stumbled upon the bar. My answer to that would be, "freak accident." 

All in all, I've always had fun here. The people who are locals and regulars always seem to have a great time. Gets busy during sporting events. Great place to hang out and grab a few drinks.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
The first time I came here I wasn't a fan, it was a busy weekend night and it was PACKED.  I'm barely a few feet behind my boyfriend, trying to get to my ID to get in, when some 21 year old looking, bleach blonde, blue-eyeshadow-wearing skank is hitting on my boyfriend, with me right behind him, as I'm giving her the stare of death, and she's asking him what his name is.  "Your name is DEAD, bitch", I think to myself, as I try to explode her head with the sheer power of my mind, and the lasers I imagine are coming out of my eyeballs.  (No, I am not a jealous person, why do you ask?)  We went to the other end of the bar, my boyfriend was smart enough to hug me and make it known we were together, but I still tried to destroy her from across the room with my secret laser-eyes and psychic powers.  

Anyway, we stayed for a drink, it was packed with drunken 20-somethings, I remember we ended up escaping out the windows, that's how busy it was.  And I never went back, because from the street on a weekend it often looks too crowded.  

About a year later I move to the neighborhood, go there early (around happy hour time) with a good girl friend of mine, joke around a little with a bartender there, and now I actually really like this place (because of the bartenders, mainly, and it doesn't hurt that it's about a block away from my new place.)  

I have a problem because I love pubs and dives but I hate beer and find regular drinks boring (I like wine and all kinds of martinis better) but I go there anyway because the bartenders make you feel very welcome and are generally pretty friendly. This "girl-drink drunk" (Kids in the hall reference, anybody know what I'm talking about?) gets by here by drinking Magners, even though I silently ponder the possible sugar and carb count as I drink it.  ("you're gonna get the diabetes")

I dare not ask for a wine, I did read their one sign "Our house wine is Jager" . . and Jager and I have had to break up many years ago although I do revisit it once in a blue moon, when my judgment is even worse than usual.
author: Muriel D.

description:
My home away from home away from home. 

Being the sister bar of the North Star, the service and quality of drink is superb. Everyone there is super cool b/c they also bartend at the NorthStar. Weird to see that it doesn't have a four star rating.

Not a five star b/c of the lack of jukebox.
author: Allan R.

description: I stopped in here for a solo pint.  Nice open and airy bar.  Folks were friendly. The staff were friendly.  Pretty sure I could spend a whole evening or two sitting at their strip of wood knocking back a few.
author: Mark D.

description:
After a miserable experience at The Bigfoot Lodge we stumbled down the hill away from the screeching frat boys singing 80s butt rock off key.

Lucky for us, we found Shanghai Kelly's. Immediately once we entered the vibe was very receptive, and very laid back. Everyone was relaxing, drinking their beverages and the juke box was pumping some cool tunes. The place wasn't shoulder to shoulder, and we were able to snag a nice table for two, no problem.

The service was good, being quick on the draw with the drinks. My only complaint was that they shut the place down at 1:30, but hey, even bar tenders sleep ... sometimes ...
author: Wes T.

description:
Awesome dive!
I'm not from 'round these here parts, but I know my dives. This place was a classic in every sense of the word. Fun. Energetic. The cops showed up and pulled some girl from the bar (I don't think she paid the cabbie). The bathroom lacked a lock so people barge in unexpectedly. No paper towels to dry you hands. They have Pabst! I'd give a full on 5 stars, but only 4 because of the blatant ignoring from the bartender (I think because I'm not a regular).
author: Alex M.

description: I love this place so much! I just enjoy the whole vibe of the bar you have to see it to enjoy all the cool stuff on the walls. This will be one of the spots I go to in SF every time I visit the staff is all so nice!
author: Ash D.

description: Nice staff. Good music. Greg is awesome. He sure knows how to fix a kamikaze. Thanks for a good time, will definitely be back!
author: Fanny C.

description:
If you are a fan of Dives - then this is the place for you. I've been a semi "regular" here for about 3 years and I love it! Always a fun, diverse crowd, good bartenders and the drinks are strong. It's a great place to end your night or begin.

If you went to Cal - you should now what I mean - then Go Bears! Always a ton of Cal fans on game days so that is something to keep in mind too. I recommend the Bart Simpson shots ($2) - it's a mix of crap, tastes like juice, and gets you drunk - can't complain.

It can get crowded because of it's size, but you can usually carve out a comfortable spot, and it's a good sports bar and crowd in general as well.
author: Nate E.

description: This is a fun bar.  You can get a decent-priced beer with fun ambiance.  If you go later at night it's really crowded.  It's not pretentious or anything like that.  And there's lots of regulars which makes it a fun place to be.
author: M C.

description:
Definitely a fun place to grab beers and kick back with friends. Shanghai Kelly's is a cozy neighborhood joint with good drinks, chill bartenders, and a fun, lively crowd. 

Unfortunately, the clientele here is typically 75-80% male so it makes for a good game-watching spot, but not so much a fun place to hit up if you're "cruising." Also, they don't serve pitchers, so that may be a downside.

Nonetheless, Shanghai Kelly's is always an enjoyable, must-visit stop if you're ever bar hopping along Polk Street.
author: Joseph F.

description:
02.12.10

This place is f-u-n fun!  Cheap booze, not too crowded, definitely not too shabby of a Friday night stop.

Plus, the restroom is not gross.  Totally awesome.  I set such low standards...

Piping hot slices of pizza across the street that you can bring in to the bar while you drink your Blue Moon on tap.  Awesome!
author: Jenny L.

description: It is a pretty much known as the SF area Steeler's Bar so what does that tell you!!  Almost enought said with that but will say I have been coming here for years and yes it is A-OK.  The staff and patrons are generally very friendly, I think perhaps that is the main reason I return.  While not a Steeler's fan they are a very friendly and often crazy group.  I usually just get a beer and watch a game on one of many of the screens they have.  I have gotten the occasional mixed drink ad it was pretty stiff and fairly priced.  Food, well I don't even think they serve it.  I have actually brought in a sandwich from up the street and they had no problem with me eating it at the bar after ordering a beer from them.
author: Damon S.

description: Shanghai's is cool! We went for the pub crawl and had a few drinks so we didn't really give them much of a chance but I would go back. I LOVE the decor in the place! I'll give them props for keeping up with our drinks though! They were packed that day! but still kept our cups full! :)
author: Leah K.

description: Decent bar on Polk, with a fun Western theme. Be careful if you come with a large group because the bar is generally crowded already.
author: Melody L.

description: Solid dive bar... not fancy. They know how to pour a proper Guinness.... slowly.  Much smaller inside than it would appear from the outside. Good place to hang with friends and co-workers.
author: John H.

description:
One word. Ick.

A friend took my gentleman and I here when another bar was just too retarded crowded. We stayed for one drink before I decided that a 40 o-of coors light and the parking lot of Safeway would be a more enjoyable alternative. 
The bartender was nice though, so extra star.
author: Mia M.

description: These are the friendliest bartenders I've ever met. The bar itself has a fun, warm atmosphere. Highly recommended!
author: Tricia T.

description: It's a great bar - definitely a Steelers Bar.  It gets crowded because there is not a lot of space, but the staff is great.  You never know who you will meet.
author: Lynna D.

description: Dive bar. Nice Owner bartenders. Cheap drinks. Too crowded. 21-28 crowd. Good location. Too noisy.  Good for Giants fans.  Might end up there again some day in the future. Order a Vanilla Gimlet.
author: Ash S.

description:
mid 20s to 30s crowd.

Small place that can be really crowded.

The bar has a lot of character and is really cool looking which makes me want to like it more than I do...

Good stop on a bar crawl to all the bars nearby
author: James B.

description: I did a Yelp search for Boston bars in SF.  This is a PITTSBURGH bar.  Good place, though.  If you are looking for a place to watch Boston sports, the Buccaneer across the street is the place to go.
author: Peter J.

description:
Bartenders from Boston ROCK!!!  Especially if they're named Brian.

I stop into Kelly's all the time to catch the score with a pint or sometimes just to read the funny sign at the entrance...very witty bunch i tell ya.

Not only are the owners Irish, but they have Irish friends too.  Ahhh, I feel like I'm right back at home when I'm here.

The annual party bus to the A's / Red Sox game is wicked fun!  
What a paahhty!  They supply the booze and tickets and you just concentrate on screaming Nomahhhhh... Yeah, it's okay that he's on the A's now, we can still say it.. it's just plain ol' fun!

If you're obsessed like I am, sign up for their mailing list too.  It's equipped w/ sports trivia, drink specials and game schedules.  

Speaking of which, I'll be catching some March Madness action with a  $3 cocktail in hand tonight!  

p.s. they are technically a Steelers bar but I won't hold that against them ;)
author: Lauren C.

description:
We stopped in for a quick drink (or two) on Saturday while my daughter was down the street getting tattooed.

There were a couple of regulars leaving and a couple more coming in - but we were treated like family all the same, by the bartender on staff named, Dave.

He even shared his egg rolls from Little Thai with us!

Very chill, good drinks, nice bartender and free food.  

That ain't too shabby!
author: Peggy N.

description:
and of course, we go to shanghai's.  Sub was there again - not sure if he was working or hanging.  Daire was working for sure.  I love this place. we always meet so many people and there's always a good story.  ended up closing this place out after a long day of fun. 

i will be here a lot. with sarah. probably liz. and absolutely with kyla and amanda. 

definitely gets packed on fri/sat nights - great for games as well.
author: Mike B.

description:
Oh Shanghai Kelly's, how is it that I always wind up in your crowded, dark interiors at the end of the night?

This is my local watering hole with cheap drinks, friendly bartenders, and a generally 20s-30s crowd.  The place is pretty small and the bathroom is tiny, but I'm usually not sober enough to let that bother me.  I would consider this a good first or last stop of the night.

I've never been here for an actual game, although it does seem to be a sports bar.
author: Nilar H.

description:
When I saw this would be the 4th stop on the golf-themed pub crawl, I was excited.

This is one of my favorite bars in San Francisco, if not my favorite. I always have tons of fun here. The place is pretty small, but it is filled with friendly bartenders, attractively priced drinks, rad music, and really cool people from all over the country (and world).

But as a 49er fan, I have to deduce one star due to the fact it is a Pittsburgh Steelers bar!

Boo!
author: Archie G.

description: Love love love it.  Super laid back and slightly-divey.  Good music, good people and not too crowded.  Can't comment on pricing since on my way in I helped the bouncer annihilate someone in Words with Friends so he hooked me up with drinks for the hour or two I spent there.
author: Katherine D.

description:
When I'm offering my recs and dishing stars on any place- 4 star, 5 diamond, diner, dump or dive- I'm aligning it with a category. 
This is a neighborhood bar. It's a shot and beer comfort zone. It's nearly perfect for it's genre. It's a 4 star wood and glass haven. I don't know why you wouldn't be good with spending a couple beers worth of time here. 
I can't say anything more than has been previously stated by others. I enjoyed spending time with a friend, watching a little game and having a few stouts. I hope I have a chance to go back.
author: John P.

description: The owners, bar keep, and doorman were all super friendly! It's a small bar with great service. People here are all pretty chill. It's a good place to get a drink and catch up with friends.
author: Lisa Q.

description:
I had wine here, why did I have wine here?

I love wine, why did I have wine here?

This place seems to be more cool and fun than it is, It was another broken promise and as I went out of there, I knew, I will never be back!

I liked the toilet though, YAY!
author: cecilia k.

description: Regular bar...I went here because my friend lived in the neighborhood. The floor was sicky. We didn't stay for long.
author: Juliet S.

description:
I don't like this bar because...
 - It's too damn small! I hate sharing tight spaces with old men and obnoxious bros!
- I'm not from the east coast so why would I like an east coast sports-themed bar?
- There are plenty of better bars in the area.
author: Scott G.

description:
I cant remember too much about this place.
The line getting in was a bloody shambles.
It was busy. Very busy.
It smelled kinda musty.
Everybody was completely shitfaced.
The toilets were a bloody disgrace.
Lots of Irish crap nailed to the walls.
There was a scottish guy behind the bar. He was cool & so was his ladyfriend.
Strange mirror at the end of the pub that you may collide with thinking its the next part of the bar.
Did I mention that the toilets were a bloody disgrace ???

Apparently, I share my surname with a canadian girl who dislikes Orlando Bloom. 
Or perhaps Orlando Bloom was telling me he disliked canadian girls who shared my surname?

Hmmm... Yes, it was nearly time to call it a night... One last stop... Hotdogs & Chilli.

[Bar #6, 12 pints down]
author: Michael H.

description:
Shanghai Kelly's is the sort of dive that if I lived nearby, I'd probably find myself hitting it up pretty frequently. Friendly patrons, strong drinks, and the sort of rowdy sports bar vibe that attracts my favorite sort of striped shirt/popped collar/former athlete. 

But since I don't live nearby, I felt like an outsider. Everyone was buddy buddy with one another, it was ass to ass crowded, and the wait for drinks was lengthy. And the dudes were all short, which of course had NO BEARING WHATSOEVER to my opinion of the place. None. Nada. Zilch. 

Plus points for two reasons:

1. I watched Oklahoma State kick some Missouri tushie here. No, I don't really know football, nor do I really like Oklahoma State. I chose the team with the better colors (orange and white are nice and summery) and ranking (17 is my favorite number). Don't you wish I was in your fantasy league now?

2. I got recognized here. Yep, little ol' inconspicuous me:

*Tap tap*
Tall chick: "Hey I know you!"
Me: "You do?"
Tall chick: "Yeah, you're the I Know I'm Fucking Tall girl from Bay to Breakers!"
Me: "Haha, wow. Good memory!"
Tall chick: "Oh I have your picture on my computer at home! I LOVE IT!"

Bow down, bitches. You just read a celebrity's review on Shanghai Kelly's. No big deal.
author: Devon S.

description:
Don't blame me this is my favorite! Classy girls like it a little trashy too!

Sorry Keith I chopped up your song a bit, but all I have to say (sing);

"We got winners, we got losers
Chain smokers and boozers
And we got yuppies, we got bikers
We got thirsty hitchhikers
And the girls next door dress up like movie stars

Hmm, hmm, hmm I love this bar

I love this bar
It's my kind of place
Just walkin' through the front door
Puts a big smile on my face
It ain't too far, come as you are
Hmm, hmm, hmm I love this bar

I've seen short skirts, we got high-techs
Blue-collar boys and rednecks
And we got lovers, lots of lookers
And I've even seen dancing girls and hookers
And we like to drink our beer from a mason jar

Hmm, hmm, hmm I love this bar
Yes I do"
-Toby Keith

YES I DO!
author: Dee C.

description:
Lots of compaints about the "frat boy douchebaggery".

Well guess what people--I'M A FRAT BOY AND PROUD OF IT!  

Nick's crispy tacos was take out only, so I came here mid day with my sac of tacos.

"You mind if I eat in here?" I asked.

"Sure--what can I get for you to drink?"

"A glass of water".

Hahah you shoulda seen the look on the guy's face.  I let it stew for about 5 seconds, and then ordered my Sierra Nevada.  Anyway, the bartender was real friendly--one of those guys who can work the room and make small talk with everyone.

Not sure about the nighttime scene, but I'd say it's worth a shot.  Bro!
author: Rocco B.

description:
I'm not a big fan of bars. Actually I don't like bars, then again I really hate bars. I see no point in paying for drinks to just stand there/sit there.  I need some dancing, but I will admit, Shanghai Kelly's is a place I would go to.

The drinks are moderately priced (actually some of them are awesomely priced).  

$2 Bart Simpson shots, I'm not sure sure WTF it was.. I think it was some OJ and some Vodka but whatever it was..it was damn good, and got me pretty buzzed.

After a fail night at Rouge Nightclub across the street, we stumbled upon this place and the crowd was pretty crackin'.  People were pretty chill and their beer selection (Blue Moon) on tap was nice too!

I didn't think I'd really fit in, but I did meet some cool people, and what are the odds, despire the name, we were the only Asian people in the whole place. The chic sitting next to me at the bar (who looked like a 100% white chic)  was actually half of my ethnicity and we shared the same last name too!! (mind you, my last name is very very very uncommon).

Definitely come back here again!
author: K D.

description:
If one more guy comes up to me and says, "Do you Yelp?" as a go to pick-up....

haha.  Just kidding.  That's the Iine I gave one of my less apprehensive friends to use on a girl at the table next to us (I'm the lady you want in your corner, boys).  And you know what?  It worked.  

He totally got digits, and he might of even copped a feel.  

Score 1 for Yelp.

Oh, and I love this bar.
author: Rachel G.

description:
been here once, no desire to come back.
Space:  narrow and crampy
Bartender:  friendly eye contact, fast service
Crowd: semi-cute guys..bought us drinks, nothing special
Music:  ??? i seem to be lacking in music memory
Bathroom:  small as hell

eehh...
author: Ann M.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said about this place?  

I like Shanghai Kelly's because it's within crawling distance of my place;
I like Shanghai Kelly's because it's a simple no frills sports bar where one can clamber up to the bar for a drink and watch sports on the TVs (or get distracted in watching the local talent get completely out of control);
I like Shanghai Kelly's because not only can you watch local talent inside, you also get the sideshow view of the craziness outside Broadway & Polk;
I especially like Shanghai Kelly's because... 

I, the idiot, due to my inability to mathematically add numbers correctly (did I mention I have dyslexia), made an obvious error in inadvertently adding an extra $10 to my already handwritten tip of $5.  I only realized this mindless error the next morning when going through my receipts from the night before.  I was puzzled when I saw an amount of $53 and was confused as my bill was $38 + $5 = $43.  Tip was approximately 50% of tab.  WTF?  I called the nice folks down at Shanghai Kelly's and they kindly assisted me in figuring out the problem....  

ME, it's my fault; I'M THE IDIOT who couldn't add correctly.  

Steve was nice enough to show me the obvious error (credit card receipt clearly reads Tip as written $5, but the total was $53), and was kind enough to reimburse the $10.  

I know I will be remembered as the dumb girl who couldn't add
And although I walked out with ears down and tail between my legs;  humiliation aside, I certainly will go back and show my face again.  And I swear, next time I'll calculate my numbers better...   no promises though.

;^P
author: Cris B.

description: Its a small bar with Top Notch Friendly Service, cheap drinks, casual atmosphere, and unique decorations. What more could you need? Definitely a great spot to hang out with some buddies.
author: Charlton Y.

description: Even if it wasn't a Steeler bar,Shanghai Kelly's would be great.  Awesome bartenders, stiff drinks, and friendly people.
author: Roland F.

description: Great local pub. Cheap beer, lots of regulars and no problems with hipsters.
author: John R.

description:
I am a big fan of this bar. Situated conveniently across the streets from the best tacos in town, Nick's Crispy Tacos, it is always a place I can call home after a big meal. Although it tends to get crowded at random hours, this bar can squuuueeeze in quite a packed house. The bartenders are good at keeping up and they are quick to serve. 

The entertainment of both the sports games on multiple tvs and the extravagant photos on the walls keeps me coming back. This is a great place to have a beer, hang out, and start your night out on Polk street right!
author: Natalie N.

description:
I don't know what took me so long to write a review for the sister bar of my fave place, Northstar. I guess I figured my review for them crossed all connected borders. 

Kelly's is fun afternoon/day time place and often good for week night sport's watching. My favorite bartender in San Francisco proper, Sub, works here AND at the Nstar...nice to know that no matter what side of the hill I'm on, I will probably see a friendly face. 

The crowd is fun, the drinks are priced fairly and the location is ideal. I wouldn't recommend this spot on a busy Friday or Saturday evening as many non-regulars crowd it up and I've seen a few fights break loose. Other than that, Kelly's is a fun spot to catch a pint and people watch on Polk :-).
author: Lynsey C.

description:
Holy crap, the way back time machine just slapped me upside the head. I just realized this is the same place that used to be called the Tender Trap. Back in the day it was just a neighborhood dive bar and from the sound of it, it still is.

4 stars just for the memories and the fact that it would even serve all us minors without fake ID's in a blink of an eye. if only we knew then...just a bunch of youngsters drinkin' Separators, Singapore Slings and Tequila Sunrises, yuck

In real life today I'm thinking more like 2 stars...
author: Keith Y.

description:
Shanghai's is pretty solid and super convenient.  It gets overly crowded on the party nights but makes for a good happy hour or hang out spot off-peak.  

Drafts are ~$5 and the place is cozy and comfortable.  Feels very much like a local / regular spot but bartenders are welcoming.
author: David K.

description: Decent vibe, but a little too small for a crowded weekend night. I've been here several times, and would go again, but not a favorite of mine.
author: Bridget B.

description:
I like this place.  A good neighborhood bar.  Hence, I am happy that it's in my neighborhood.  It's here that I discovered that I have had enough therapy to immediately spot others in need (of therapy, that is).  I have many revelations in bars, but few have been this useful.  

Thank you.
author: Pammy C.

description:
Came here last night after dinner for some drinks...

It's a nice local dive bar, but it just doesn't have anything going for it that is a huge draw for me, aside from selling booze...which clearly gets me every time, damn.

They did have an atlas on the bar, and I love atlases, so that was a plus, random, and good for drunk convo.  The bartenders were friendly and filled up my glass every time I drained it...which was too many times last night...something in my head convinced myself that gin and tonics help you when you're sick, something about quinine and malaria, and that was all it took....
author: Kristin E.

description: A great bar to go to during the week when it's not too crowded. Very chill atmosphere, and located in the prime area of Polk street. I don't so much enjoy coming here if it's too crowded. I'm not aware of drink specials and such, but I'm sure they probably have some. A great local spot!
author: Ashley D.

description:
I came here a couple weeks ago to watch the Steelers game. I was in San Francisco for the weekend and heard it was one of the better Steelers bars in San Francisco, but what does that even mean?

I strolled in, bald head, sun glasses and 86 jersey in tow and found a place to sit down. To my horror, the dude next to me was drinking a Naked Juice through a straw that he seemed way too fond of and the C&C I ordered worked out to like $2 an ounce.  I was already missing Gabes' standard issue Dixie cups my C&C's usually come in. This was bullshit.

Then, just as I was getting comfortable on my bar stool and finishing my drink, this lady comes in with 2 bags full of appetizers from Whole Foods. She had some sun-dried tomato hummus, rice crackers, and some funky expensive looking cheese she seemed to be saving for when the party really got started. I didn't even know the fans of the Pittsburgh Steelers could develop such sophisticated palates. I know I hadn't.

Needless to say, I got up from my seat and headed to the other end of the bar. Gouda is not going to ruin my day! But unknowingly, I had relocated to the heart of the freak show. I ended up beside this shaggy dude in a black trench coat who started shaking his hands in the air in front of him like the one man chosen by Jesus to save our souls. He repeatedly shouted, "UNLEASH THE HOUNDS!!!!"

I glanced back at the door. It wasn't too late, but my loyalty to the Steelers forced me to endure the circus around me. Once the game was fully underway, I settled into my spot and met several really cool people around me and the place quickly filled with Steelers fans that were just as rowdy as the ones I'm used to. This Steelers bar definitely felt like San Francisco and after the Steelers won everyone poured out into the streets, waving their Terrible Towels.

All in all this was a fun place to watch the game, but this is definitely the bar the rest of the Steeler Nation doesn't brag about to it's friends or talk about publicly..
author: EG X.

description:
Friday night and the vibe was right! I love that feeling of camaraderie that I start to feel with every single person in a bar after I've had four or five drinks! There was still room to move around when I arrived  around 10 PM, but after about an hour, people were crammed in this place like sardines! We found a comfy little spot in the back and stuck with it for most of the night ... definitely camp out by an open window if it's a warm night!

At some point I went outside for a breath of fresh air and got a random fist pound from a passing stranger...as he walked by I said "Happy Friday!" ... he came back for a second fist pound! So what have we learned?? Friday night + Shanghai Kelly's = good vibes
author: Nate R.

description:
Like George Costanza, I often get the sense of worlds colliding at Shanghai Kelly's.  But in a good way.  Like the Summer of George was supposed to be.

I love running into friends at Shanghai Kelly's and it often seems to be a good mix of people who often don't leave their favorite 'hood, whether it's the Mission, North Beach, the Marina, or Oakland even.  I had my bday here last year for this very reason.  I've always had fun there, except if it's super crowded, but I could say that about any bar.

Met the owner (who also owns Northstar) a couple months ago and he is genuinely nice (and also hosted the Oakland PD fundraiser at Northstar, which was very cool of him).  

Shanghai Kelly's is a good place to start or end the night.  And try the Bart Simpson shot, even though you may think it sounds weird.
author: Laura B.

description:
So....this is a sports bar??? If it was at all condusive to watching sports I would at least give it marks for that. The closest parallel I was able to draw is that frat boys like sports and there were lots of boys pining away for their frat days here.  

My guy friend tried to say hi to an attractive girl when we first walked in and she proceeded to tell him to fuck off and fling his hat off his head onto the nasty floor. Who knew saying hi was so offensive??!!

I met a drunk corporate lawyer and we had a lovely drunken conversation with no substance whatsoever. I wont even get into how that carousing turned out, but lets just say I am in no hurry to hang out here again.
author: Drue C.

description:
Im a dive bar fan
I am a Bloody Mary fan
I am a football fan
I am from New England.....and can watch my games here
I am a Shanghai fan

for a dive bar you cant ask for much more
author: Kasey D.

description:
At almost any bar, I can usually push, shove and squeeze my way to the bar and get a drink.  I followed some friends into Shanghai Kelly's on a Saturday night, and barely took 3 steps in the door before I was completely surrounded by drunken revelers.  I myself had just started to brown out so I was with like company.

It's not a very large space, but I was still shocked at how many people they were able to cram in there.  The big plus was that there seemed to be no shortage of attractive women making this a huge boon to single lads such like myself.  The atmosphere was pretty lively and fun, if I actually got a drink I'd give this place 4 stars.  But the ladies in our group weren't interested in waiting for their drinks, so we continued on to The Buccaneer.

There is a pay parking lot ($10) not more than a block or two away that can used if street parking is too hellish.
author: Eric L.

description: Only been here once, but I really liked it. If I lived nearby, I could see myself hanging out here often.  A great mix of people, good selection of beers, fun stuff hanging on the walls, tv's.  It doesn't sound like anything special, but it just seemed like a cool place for a beer.
author: Kacey A.

description:
Came in here after a few drinks and everyone was more wasted, let me re-phrase that..completely and utterly sloshed.
The bouncer almost threw up as he took our ids, the bartender lost her memory and forgot to charge us for our drinks, the people were swaying and singing into our shoulders, heart to hearts were being given between girls all around us, every collar was popped
Fun for the very shit-faced
Strange for the semi-sober
author: Daniella B.

description:
Divebar? Yes
Pretentious? No
Pretty people? Depends on the night
Good bartenders?  Yes...buy them a shot if you get a chance
Good decor? Not unless you have bad taste
Good Bar?  ABSOLUTELY.  DAMN GREAT BAR
...and I wouldn't change a thing!
author: Young P.

description:
Great bartenders, a little booth in the back that we all bombarded and bar seating as well.  Great atmosphere!  Lots of STUFF everywhere to look at, on the walls, ceiling, everywhere.  It's a hilarious place that doesn't take itself too seriously.

They have a great- did I say GREAT shot?!  OMAMARAMA...$3 all night long.  It's a pre-made shot (they make it in the morning) that is vodka-based bust tastes like Koolaid.  I can get down with that.  You can shoot it or just sip it, because I was broke and wanted that thing to last! haha. I had a carbomb, a gin and tonic and 2 ObamaRamas...that was some good stuff!

Great prices, good tenders, great environment and good people.
Recession Buster!
author: Jillian K.

description:
Ok I admit it; I am getting too old to be at the Buccaneer at 2:00 am with my buddies. Last time I was, I made a fool of myself trying to talk to a 20 something gal and look cool, while playing dice. Then on the walk home was spotted from a friend's window throwing up in the street. Thanks Teague for the 10 Fernets.  

Dave on the other hand at Shanghais will challenge me with trivia and if I can not get the ones he says are easy,  I know it is time to go.  

There are a number of things that every bar needs to get 5 stars.
1) Good Bartenders
2) Amusing stuff to look at on the walls when you are sick of looking at your friends.
3) Great music not only on the Juke box but also in the cd player when you are the only person in the place.
4) When you put your money on the bar you leave it! the bartender takes out what is needed for each round as you go.
5) When someone backs you up, it is signaled by an upside down shot glass, not a chip or just another drink sitting there getting warm. It's like an advertisement saying, hey at least someone likes me!
6) A free drink every one in a while. 
7) A kick ass super bowl party 
8)  A good mix of people in the crowd 
9) A bus trip to a game a few times a year!
10) Ice cold Bud bottles

Shanghai's has them all!
author: michael h.

description: I didn't love this place. But really don't have any specific complaint to point at.  Just nothing stands out for me.  Oh, except for the fact that there was a line for the men's bathroom while I happily pranced on by to a completely empty women's bathroom.  Perhaps bc I was one of three women in the place.  Wait, I like this place more now that I think about it.
author: Meg W.

description: Experienced this place at the CRAWLOWEEN 2013. This place rocks. Good drinks, friendly bartenders - when I remember it correctly. Can only reco this place.
author: Dave T.

description: Good bar, but annoying simply that it is a Shittsburgh steelers bar. Hello, this is SF, not Pittsburgh, one of the nastiest places I have ever been to in my life (the city of Pittsburg, not the bar)
author: Jim B.

description:
I don't understand it, but whenever I got out in Russian Hill, we somehow always end up at Shanghai Kelly's before the night is over.

Personally, I think this is the best neighborhood bar in Russian Hill.  Bartenders are a lot of fun and will sometimes do shots with you.  Crowd is young and friendly, I always meet new people.
author: Bobby J.

description:
Ayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyeeee (Said Like a Pirate)

OK, so maybe "Shanghai Kelly" isn't a pirate, but I like to think of him as one!  Instead of a sword though, he has a club, wears a bowler  atop his rather round cranium, and calls me Nancy! (OK, I probably got that from the sign on the bar, but I swear he called me Nancy once!!)

You never know what may happen at his place! He may challenge you to a game of liar's dice, or he may force you to drink his special "Bart Simpson" shot  (I don't know what's in it, but I'm pretty sure he stuck Bart in a blander,  cause it tastes sassy and sweet at the same time).

Be careful walking through his bar cause the place can get crowded with all different types of folks.

The bartenders are attentive and always willing to get you another.  The bathroom (Well the men's anyways) provides entertainment as well.  Plenty to read when you're relieving yourself :D

Just remember that once you enter Shanghai Kelly's, you'll never leave the same.... Mostly cause you'll be pretty drunk!
author: Chris G.

description:
Can't wait to move back to SF later on this year. I want to be a regular at Kelly's again. I want to do countless mind erasers and shots of Fernet or Jamison or Jack or Jim or Corralejo with my pint o Guinness.
I walked into kelly's several years ago on a Sunday afternoon with a lady for some cocktails. Two hours later we were on a plane for Vegas. Eight hours after that we were partying with Slayer in our suite at the Hard Rock Hotel. And I do mean PARTAYIN! Pablo Escobar would have been proud. 24 hours later were hitched by a fat Elvis impersonator.
Shanghai Kelly's, I hold you responsible.
author: Bill H.

description: Love this place not only because it is my favorite place to watch STEELERS games when not at Heinz field. The bartenders are cool as all get out, the owners are just as cool. Nice place to just grab a beer and shot.
author: DJ J.

description:
The only difference between the Polk Street bar scene (Shanghai Kelly's  included) and 16+ DJ shows is less neon. At least at the former the music is better, and no one (yet) has spilled beer on my jacket two minutes after arriving.

My apologies if this is what I acted like in my early 20s.
author: Jason B.

description:
We hold these truths to be self-evident:
Sports Bars are obviously lame.
San Francisco sports teams are obviously lame as well.
The fans of San Francisco sports teams are the lamest of them all.
To be a fan of the Pittsburgh Steelers, the city of Pittsburgh, or any of the three rivers is ridiculous.

Now despite all of this, this bar has a self-depricating quality about it that is very charming. The staff is very nice and laid back as well. I would not mind coming back here on a lazy, early Sunday afternoon to drink some nice cold beers whatsoever. Nice work Kelly's.
author: Benji T.

description: Really a Steelers bar in San Fran!!!!!! Go NINERS!!! Place is actually pretty cool though.
author: Mike B.

description:
Not sure if I like this place or not.

Witnessed a yuppie in a sport coat rush through the door and start yelling at the top of his lungs announcing his presence.  Maybe a hard day at the office?  Finally gnawed off the chain connecting him to his desk?

Despite looking like a total dive bar on the outside, this place is lively.  The crowd's mainly yuppies huddled together and random frat guys walking around like zombies on weekday nights but the music is good and the ambiance is enough to get the adrenaline pumping to pound some drinks.
author: Jenny K.

description: I would usually choose other bars on Polk Street rather than Shanghai Kelly's if I were picking but I would definitely be willing to go here if it were a friend's choice. The decor is super random and fun to look at and the drinks are reasonably priced. It's fun to watch football here and nice that you can bring your own food in. It gets pretty packed though and it's hard to socialize with too many people in the long skinny bar set-up. My friends and I invented a fun people-watching game at this bar though...
author: Meghan P.

description:
Play dice?  Nothing better than a few beers and some Midnight at this local watering hole...
I did try a Crangerine drink special the other day, which I have to say was not my favorite.  
Make sure you ask to get on the Shanghi/Northstar e-mailing list.
author: Lisa D.

description: Probably tied for my second favorite bar in the city. Very eclectic crowd. On weekday afternoons its guys you might find at 'Cheer's (TV version). After 7 pm it has more of a Marina/North Beach vibe so you get a bit of both, which is nice. Plus they serve PBR tallboys, I think, which is just, fantastic. Plus its a Steelers bar, and as a Steelers fan it pleases me.
author: Josh A.

description: They're a great neighborhood bar.  The bartenders are nice, the place is clean, the drinks aren't overpriced and they have plenty of televisions.  It's a small place so it can get packed at peak hours, but it's everything you want in a neighborhood watering hole.
author: Corey V.

description:
Ughh. I once brought a French guy visiting from Paris to Shanghai Kelly's. It wasn't my choice - my other friend wanted to watch some sports game on the TV. But I digress.

I brought said Frenchie to Shanghai Kelly's for a nice, cold drink. Apparently, bringing a French person to this bar is akin to bringing a French person to Congress during the whole "freedom fries" debacle. The bartender at Shanghai Kelly's was utterly offended by Frenchie's presence. 

First, he ignored my dear friend's pleas for a drink. He ignored him as if my friend was invisible, even though he was sitting right in front of the bartender's grizzly old face. Finally I piped up and demanded a drink. This then turned into a fight over whether a passport is legitimate to use as proof of age. The bartender insisted that Frenchie have a California drivers license. Umm... right. I'm sure he had time to get one of those in customs.

Anyway, I could go on and on, but basically I don't recommend that you go here - especially if you're French.
author: Ava S.

description: been here a few times and it is always a solid end of the night place. The bar is always packed so getting a drink is often a waiting process and a lot of jockeying for bar position.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Liked it! 

Fun dive (but not too dive-y) bar with friendly bartenders and generous pours...  and if you're lucky enough you can score that large comfy booth in the back.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Recently, I was reluctant to go here because of the massive crowds.  It's a small bar, but very popular.  This time, I went a little early for bar time, and it was pleasantly fun (and not super crowded).  

DISCLAIMER:  
Looks are not everything.  I'm a firm believer in that.

But let's be honest, it doesn't hurt to have some decent looking people around you while drinking.  Yeah, you can't argue with that.

I feel like most times I come here, me and my friends get surrounded by the most unattractive guys, but last night - not so.  There were a handful of attractive people in the bar.  I was pleasantly surprised.

They serve newcastle (my fave beer) and jaeger shots - always a huge plus in my book.  

Therefore, Shanghai Kelly's is now at 3.5 status, with potential for 3.75/4 in the future.

Thanks.
author: Angie C.

description:
Even if this bar WASN'T just a quick stumble away from my doorstep, I think I would still consider it "my bar."  Many a night out has ended with the brilliant suggestion, "Let's go to Shanghai's!"  Sweet music to mine ears.

It's a small bar with a fairly modest, yet adequate beer selection, but overall it just has a great feel.  Friendly and unpretentious.  Fun decor.  It's just a great place to unwind with friends.

"Adventure.  Intrigue.  Romance."  What more could you want from a bar?
author: Carolyn H.

description:
I've never been to Shanghai Kelly's. But. It's rumored that there is a photographic homage to my rack in the men's room. To me that means this MUST be a classy place.

Edited to reflect news:

I have since been the Shanghai Kelly's and it's fun, but crazy crowded, and close enough to the Marina to feel that visceral dating desperation in many of the members of the crowd.  So, minus one star.  I had a peak in the men's restroom and the photo of my torso was indeed hanging prominently over the toilet.  Lovely.  But I've heard that the photo has since been removed.  That photo was a classic, damnit.  Minus another star.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
This is actually a solid place to meet people. I have met some real cuties here and the dudes here are pretty mellow and relaxed. Everyone who comes here is just lookin to have a good time. There are alot of places to sit and the bartenders are cool peeps. 

Note- Don't bring your friend who looks like THOR god of thunder and have him get the drunk eye. Because while i am conversing with a cute breezie, her friend asks me why that guy is looking at her with a a very mean drunk, creepy eye. I pretend like I don't know him, but when he gets kicked out, the bouncer says "Who is with this guy?"  "ME", I softly utter as I proceed to leave the place and utterly crash and burn in my attempts to converse with members of the opposite sex, because of THOR.
author: Ash D.

description:
Today is my birthday, and I am currently in New Orleans for work and have been for the past month, so I thought now would be an appropriate time to write my review of Shangs. Why you ask? Because if there is one place I wish I could be tonight drinking until I can't see straight, it would be this bar. I love the bartenders, I love the drinks, I love watching the cheesy people at Rouge across the street. 

I miss you, Shanghai Kelly's.
author: Kristen D.

description:
Kelly's should get 5 stars because of its embodiment of the perfect neighborhood corner bar. Whether I go to watch a game or the finish off the evening, it's always good times. Kick-ass jukebox too. 

You would also think I would also give this place 5 stars because the bartender gave me and some friends a round of strange-looking shots for helping him figure out what Fitty Cent's real name was (yes - we're all about the intellectual convo). But since all 4 of us had hangovers the next day (and 2 of the 4 spent some time puking later that night), I'm taking away the 5th star for that horrible mystery green concoction we were given. Beware.
author: Dalia K.

description: $5 Guinness!  Friendly attentive bar tenders and casual atmosphere, my kind of bar scene.  Not really sure about the name though because there was zero Shanghai influence for this place, but oh wells, still a cool place to hang out.
author: Yun W.

description:
I like bars where men outnumber women 5 to 1.

Minus one star for not getting one free drink out of the night.
author: Erin F.

description:
Seems like a definitely great place to do a meet up with a bunch of buddies, excellent place to start off a night.

Drinks were relatively cheap and the bartenders were really easy-going, tho one of my compadre's drink was a tad on the weak side (i think it's just a one time deal).  But hey, can't complain with their selection of alcohol, and all of my guinness were perfectly poured.

It was really quite crowded at the time, and it was pure luck that awarded us two seats at  the bar.  So prepare for some elbow bumping fun.
author: Victor S.

description:
My Russian Hill haunt, 
Adventure, Intrigue, Romance, 
Needs a few more girls.
author: Brian J.

description:
There is a sign in this bar that says "Our house wine is Jagermeister." What more do you need to know?

I don't think you can have a bad time here. It's not the place to go if your idea of a fun night out is wearing tight jeans, wearing sunglasses (inside a dark bar at night) and unbuttoning your shirt halfway in hopes of scoring with that highly functioning mongoloid from the Real World/Road Rules Challenge that's on tour, but if you typically leave your collar un-popped you will  have an awesome time here.
author: Don H.

description:
It would be wrong for me to give this place anything less than 5 stars.  Especially considering the number of times I've been here and the debauchery I have caused.

It's small and gets crowded and is nothing special in terms of the decor, but damnit - that's why I like it.  I always have a good time here and inevitably run in to people I know.  It's like Cheers only I am usually too intoxicated to just sit at the bar.
author: Miss M G.

description: Sunday afternoon..post tennis..grab a couple of slices and chill at Kelly's. Laid back atmosphere..cold beers...sports on TV...life is REALLY good...
author: Mimi T.

description: This spot is divey, fun and completely low-key.  It has a masculine kitschy vibe that makes it a perfect spot to hang with a close group of friends.  The selection of beer and liquor is good and they have a jukebox where you listen to a decent selection of 70s and 80s hits.  Definitely worth checking out if you want to grab a beer and not get dressed-up.
author: Ken G.

description:
I am generally here to meet up with the Mayo brothers, who live just down the street.  They're usually watching football or something like that, and we always end up smooshed into the corner by the jukebox.  

I suspect that there is a phantom farter that follows me around from bar to bar in Russian Hill, and he always seems to make his presence felt at this place first.  The funny part is watching everybody go on about their business, as though nothing happened.  

That only seems to encourage him (or her).  Whoever it may be...
author: Gopal R.

description: This is a great bar to grab a couple beers.  The bartenders are really friendly, and there seem to be a lot of regulars.
