I've taken several friends that were on town visiting here and I feel like it has a good mix of being active enough without being too packed like some of the other bars on Polk.
author: Ted G.

description:
When I first moved to the city, I ended up here alot.  So, it almost pains me to rate it lower than a 4.  
I'll consider Shanghai's a 3++.  After all, it's a place to chill w/ some friends and grab and beer.  It's affordable, has a friendly staff, and some decent spaces to chill.
author: Robby T.

description:
The people here are always so nice! ....and the bartender didn't get all pissy when I ordered water for my sorry drunk ass.

...and that's about all I can remember from my three - count 'em - three visits here. I might want to work on that... or talk to my AA counselor.
author: Ali L.

description:
There isn't anything to get too excited about with this bar.  It is pretty blah.  I mean, yeah, the vibe is more cool than some other spots in this area but... just leave the area.  It is almost always packed.

Bartenders are kind-of nice.
Prices are kind-of cheap.
Beer selection is OK.

Sounds like a three star to me.
author: Thadd L.

description:
It ain't easy being a Cleveland Indians fan in San Francisco. Especially during the post-season. Especially when my team's playing the Red Sox. Seems like no matter where I go, every pub in this town has been claimed by legions of the Sox Nation. Shanghai's is no exception. But no matter, I can put my biases aside and write a straight-up, balanced review about this place. 

Shanghai's will give you typical beer -- Bud, Coors, Miller -- along with the usual craft brews like Fat Tire (no complaints there) for cheap. Went here on a Thursday and a Coors Light was $3.50. Which is about as much as anyone should pay for such a crappy beer. But hey, there's something about baseball and a watery American pilsner that just sings. 

There will usually be a hefty crowd in this small joint, but nothing that would spoil your good time. It's that kind of old-school pub that you want to be crowded, a little noisy, and boisterous. And you know, lot's of random memorabilia and pictures on the wall, kind of rundown and oh yes, a little sticky. 

When I first moved here, I would always confuse this place with North Star in North Beach. And while I like Shanghai's a lot better, the two definitely seem like cousins to me. Except the North Star attracts way more toolbags. 

Good place to watch sports, as they have a few large TVs.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Stopped there last night for celebratory drinks as my friend just finished another degree.   Hopefully, he'll be able to get that raise he was looking for.  Not sure why that was relevant.  So let me get back to reviewing this place.

I would describe this as a divey, neighborhoody bar near the Broadway tunnel on Upper Polk Street.  Bartenders were friendly, but definitely worried about IDs.  I was checked twice in less than 5 minutes.  God Damn!  But at least they do a better job of patrolling than the SFPD.

Beers were between $3.50 - $5.00.  I think they were having MGDs and Miller High Lifes specials for $2.50.  A great price for the "Champagne of Beers."  The decor inside was interesting.   This place was described as a saloon, but the only thing that seemed to say this was the split door.  The ceiling was covered with an assortment of banners.  A few TVs on the walls, which could make this place a pretty good place to catch some of the upcoming Bowl games. 

If I had to go back?  I would say "Yes."

Here go the STARs:

+1 STAR - The place was fairly low key, making it a nice place to grab a few drinks with friends.

+1 STAR -  PBR on tap and Miller High Lifes for $2.50, can't beat that.

+1 STAR - Reminded me of a smaller version of Northstar.  I guess this could be a -1 STAR for some.
author: James C.

description:
Had a good time here last night. Basically determined that the walls could have some updated memorabilia and pictures from this decade....

It wasn't a bad place to grab a beer on a Sunday. 

I don't think I would have it as a destination bar, more one to just go in along the way.
author: Danielle V.

description: Its STEELER time. Came here for the superbowl, and loved the atmosphere. The bartenders are great, and even though the place was packed, they were responsive and prompt. Will make this my new steeler hangout joint :-)
author: Gurpreet S.

description: Bartenders are great and always good for a laugh. And if you're lucky, you might even see lesbians groping the shit out of each other. VERY NIIIICE.
author: O'Shea J.

description:
Good juke box, plenty of dudes - Is it The Buc?  Nope, its the other good juke box dude bar on Polk....Shanghai Kelly's.

I recommend the PBR and a shot of Jamison's.  Perfect way to drink with your buddies and avoid the seediness across the street at Rouge.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Fun place, unpretentious, great sports bar atmosphere, Stevie Wonder in the jukebox, affable...besides, they have Fat Tire!!! Me likey.

So, the night I was here, this drunk dude from Milwaukee came up to us and went on and on about how he didn't understand how us "cats from San Francisco" [I'm a semi-proud Angelino] paid so much money to live here and proceeded to brag about his $550 3-bedroom mortgage on Lake Michigan and how he used to sell antiques and how he loved Frank Lloyd Wright. The he left us alone. I was friendly and conversational, though deep inside I wished he'd go away. Of course, if he was a cute girl, it would've been a different story...
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Shanghai Kelly's was a really cool bar. The bartenders were attentive and fast. One high point of Shanghai Kelly's were the people there. Sometimes bars are just filled with groups of people who don't want to talk to other people - but there were lots of people wanting to make friends. Good stuff. 

I like the windows going along the side of the bar, 'cuz if you're done there, you can just climb out one. Unfortunately, I ripped my jeans down the crotch doing this...you have been warned.
author: Matt S.

description:
1st Review:

BORING.

The whole night there was boring, it was like being in the East Bay again.

2nd Review: 

I had fun there on a Monday night with a small crowd.
author: Lindsay T.

description:
I don't know about this place...I just came here for the first time this weekend and maybe I need to go again...It was right after some kind of Polk St pub crawl, so there were obviously stragglers who were extremely drunk hanging out all around inside this bar.  When I walked in, there was a group of people belting out their alma mater at the top of their lungs.  Red Flag, I thought to myself.  Red. Flag.  

The bartender was nice, but when I asked this group of guys to scoot over so I could get a drink, one of them chuckled and said "make it quick!"  Red. Flag.  

I agree with one of the posters below.  Being packed in a sardine can is not my idea of a hilarious good time.  Especially when I am being groped by a  guy who looks like he is 14 years old.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Football season + cold Miller High Life's + Fernet  + attentive barhands = my tribute to getting Shanghaied in San Francisco.

know your history:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Kelly_(crimper)
author: Jason N.

description: I hear this is a Lakers bar, so I definitely need to get back soon. I loved the crazy eclectic SF bartenders. One and her dad were busy dancing salsa in the back. I had an intense conversation about nothing I can remember now with an off duty bartender that ended up buying me, my boyfriend and all his guy friends a few shots (not that I remember) at the end of the night. One of the boys also met a Google recruiter. All in all there are plenty of good reasons to return!
author: Esperanza A.

description:
I like it!!!

I went on a Friday night.  There was a good crowd and it was poppin'.  (And by "good crowd" I mean minimal old people and no douchebag guys in blazers and button-downs.)  

They've got Miller Lite and PBR and that gets two thumbs up from me!
author: Ellen B.

description:
Never been a huge fan of this spot.  It's a solid place for getting together with friends and having fun; however it ends up a little crowded for my tastes.  It's long and narrow (because so few bars in San Francisco are, right) and people pack in continually all night resulting in a hot sweaty drunken throng bubbling with conversation.

The crowd is generally pretty/handsome and mid 20s - late 30s.  These are not the upscale trendy ppl of the Marina nor are they the decadent critical hipsters of Hayes Valley but the bone fide party people.  That's the good part.

The bad part is that the bar keep packing it in.  Thankfully there's a lot going on in the vicinity.
author: John R.

description:
It's a Boston Bar - which sucks - but when ever I go in, they'll find a TV to turn on the Yankee game for me.  Much better than Greens and service is always great.  Best bartenders around!
Either first stop or last stop...  gets me in trouble all the time!
author: Jodi B.

description:
I wouldn't call this place a "dive bar"...it's too clean for that.  I always have a great time here.  Looking at the pictures on the wall and reading the captions are always entertaining distractions.  The bartenders are absolute sweethearts...love these guys...and gals!!  I only ever have to tell them once what I'm having and the rest of the night I just walk up and they already know.  Brilliant!  Considering I drink so much, most of the time they throw in one or two for free.  Double brilliant!!

This is a great place to take a group of friends and hang out.  It's not a spot to come to meet people.  Make friends before coming here.  It's a bar, folks.  A place to drink, talk and maybe watch some sports.  The atmosphere here is casual and easygoing.  Y'know, the type of place "where everybody knows your name."
author: Erin H.

description:
To put it simply, Shanghai's is a phenomenal locals dive bar. Great bartenders, great owners, great music, and (if you're a Giants, Red Sox, Steelers, or in this case  Dallas Stars fan.) The place is full of locals, as it should be. Leave all attitude behind because there isn't enough room. On a week night, grab dinner at Nick's, Polkers, etc. and relax watching the game. 
There are more than a few people who take Shanghai Kelly's t-shirts  around the world to send back pictures.  Make and Steve have a gem. Go Bears.
author: Tim F.

description: I went here on my 21st birthday after a disappointing night at Rouge across the street. I needed a bar atmosphere and in my drunken state, made it across the street to this place. To the best of my drunken memory, it was 1:30 AM and the place was packed, The place itself is pretty small to begin with and the World Cup finals were going on, so a lot of people were celebrating. I got my rum and coke which was only $6.50. Not bad at all. The bartender was nice and  gave me my moneys worth. Lots of rum and a splash of coke. I went to the bathroom and boy, it felt like I was peeing into a corner. But overall, the atmosphere of the place was nice if you want to grab a quick beer with friends.
author: Leslie K.

description: my neighborhood bar, always get my drinks right away.  fastass service and great people that work there.
author: Kevin L.

description:
A pretty average SF bar with nothign special but nothign bad.  Definitely great with some of the drink specials at night.  The place is also quite small but hey its cheap booze
---------------------------
I cant believe I didnt give this place atleast 4 stars.  After coming here on numerous occasions, I have realized that this place is money.  When i think polk  street, i think shanghai and buccaneer.
author: Charles C.

description:
Shanghai Kelly's was the first bar I went to after completing my relocation to San Francisco, and I tell you what, every time I walk by I can still smell the desparation from 10 feet away. Literally, it's a smell. 

I do have to attest however, that any time I've gone there, I've made several shithoused friends and had a great time.

A lot of dudes come here, ps, and ladies be sure to select carefully and go with your instincts... just take my word for it. Lotta frat types and older versions of frat types.

There is a gleaming light with the regulars, as they're just awesome in general and always up for a good laugh at some of the people that stop in. Best feature: the bartenders and door guys are both spectacular and hilarious.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I don't remember much about this place.   Very noisy and crowded.   I had to yell in order to be heard. 

"Yes!  Yes!  YES!  Republicans are crooks!  You are SO RIGHT!"

I love Stoli and tonic.  (with a chaser of chronic.)

The BEST thing about this place is that you can find street parking close by and you won't run into any bums peeing in the gutter on the walk down to the bar.  Awesome.
author: Mimi V.

description: Outstanding cozy bar, end of the night.  Friendly bartender made me a kickass rusty nail.  Nuff Said.  Look forward to starting the night here.
author: Blake t.

description:
so i had just spent all day moving alicia k. into her new apartment up the street, and i decided we needed some drinks STAT after dealing with her overly medicated cat that had been screaming from inside his crate for FOUR hours, my fat ass lifting box after box of shit i know she will never use and the fact that her new fridge contained nothing but a half finished bottle of champagne we had started on earlier.  so we decided to make the pacific heights/russian hill bar rounds, alas shanghai kelly's.

i REALLY hate sports bars, and maybe it's unfair but i feel like when i make the trek to the city from san jose i should be inidated with only fabulous places, ones that only involve $15.00 fresh squeezed organic cocktails, hot, beautiful gay men that smell good and bar food that consists of "artisan cheese plates" and "free range australian beef tongue sliders".  i can get ugly dudes in sharks jerseys and cheese fries at home...  so shanghai kelly's was kind of a nice surprise!  no douchebags, great liquor selection, heavy pours and a hot gay bartender.  half of the bar did however look at me like i was the red devil when i suggested turning off the sunday night football game for the 9:00 episode of "the golden girls" i knew was coming on the lifetime channel...

so you take what you can get i guess, and they will see more of us.
author: Jessie J.

description: If you're from Pittsburgh, lonely and don't want to watch Jerome Bettis and the Steelers stomp all over some hapless team by yourself in your apartment.  Dust off your terrible towel, put on your Big Ben jersey and get your arse down to Shanghai Kelly's where all the SF Steelers fans congregate on gameday.  Loads of fun and neighbourhoody, even if you're not a Steelers or football fan.
author: I. O.

description:
Not your typical pit stop during a short visit to SF, but a great local spot to grab a beer. The bar tender was great and the bathroom was surprisingly clean by female standards. 

I also went on a Monday night and managed to have a decent time without feeling like I was at an AA meeting. No small feat.

**Single Ladies Alert: According to shanghaikellys.com, this cozy neighborhood bar boasts a strong male to female ratio. Then again, the legend goes, "The odds are good, but the goods are odd" and they have been known to slip patrons 'Mickey's' before shipping them off to China. I still say it's worth a shot (if you're into tattoos, that is).
author: Gina V.

description: Very neighborhood-y Irish pub, but the bartenders and crowd is always super nice! Daire is awesome, he works thursdays and sundays, I think.
author: Jasvir S.

description: I hated this place on sight, but since it's about a block from my house, I had to give it a try. From the frat boy crowd to the warm beer that I was served, I have nothing good to say about this place. Oh, and a big fuck you to all the damn people who binge drink here and then stagger up the street to throw up outside my bedroom window. Damn you all.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I don't really get the hype over Shanghai Kelly's.  It's your average corner dive with a few beers on tap and a jagermeister dispenser.  The stools at the bar are too low and make you feel 4 ft. tall, the bartenders are friendly enough but the place is just nothing special.  If you live next door or are doing a Polk St. pub crawl, stop by.  Otherwise get a $6 beer somewheres else.
author: Erin L.

description: Great bar almost any time of day!  Cheap drinks, free spare livers, and friendly bartenders.  Kelly's is a great Sunday alternative to the mayhem of Green's down the street and never disappoints!
author: Craig E.

description: Pittsburgh born and bred, I love this bar...roll out of bed hungover 9 am on a Sunday, so you can catch the Steelers, along with all those other crazy football fans. This is as close to Heinz Field you'll get on this side of the Mississippi! And uhh, I might have been featured on Kron dancing on the bar after the Super Bowl win last year.
author: Julianne M.

description: This place is a total dive and what's more it's packed with loud, obnoxious people. Which I guess is expected for a sports bar but these people are espescially loud and obnoxious and all the TVs are rather poorly spaced for suitable sports watching. The city is filled with sports bar so skip this one and find a bar with more places to sit and better TVs.
author: Cathy T.

description: A cool little place with a few too many guys in the Justin Timberlake hoodie-n-sportscoat look.  The bar staff mixes some good drinks and always have that "you're lucky I'm serving you" gleam in their eye.  I didn't catch her name but the female bartender there last night had some sharp wit to her and we were jabbing at each other all night.  good times.  So why 3 stars?  To narrow, and not quite enough of whatever "it" is to get above this.  I'd stop by if I was in the neighborhood, but this isn't the place to go out of your way for.
author: Zakk D.

description: Went here for some late night drinks and it was packed. It's nothing too special. Standard bar stuff. I'm convinced the 20 or so beers i drained here helped me play guitar hero like a champ at 3am that night though.
author: Stephen K.

description: Stopped in here for the first time tonight eventho walking/driving it past it many times....nice lil local bar and we secured some bar stools in the corner and chatted among the jukebox music and TV in the background. Interestingly enough a fight broke out with broken glass and a guy being punched in his mouth. The fight continued on to the busy intersection of Polk and Broadway until the bouncer broke it apart. Nasty sight with blood stains on the road, so much drama for the night....reminds me of a high school but only these were not high school kids. This is Shanghai Kelly's, not "Shanghai Knight", perhaps these guys were depicting Jackie Chan and Owen Wilson fighting the bad guys?
author: Yan M.

description: Probably the last place on Polk I would go to watch a game. If you like being sandwiched next to dudes, then this is the place for you. They do have beer, so they have that going for them...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I think my experience here was a bit fault because it was a Saturday night and pretty empty.  I think it was because of the rainstorm outside that nobody but my dumbself would venture out.  I came here after Nick's since they stopped serving alchy so early and rouge wasnt open yet (I also might not have been cool enough for rouge).  Didn't really have any opinion on Shaghai Kelly's.  Quick service, lots of tables, not too dirty but not too posh.  Didn't notice much else.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
there's more to the word shanghai than just being a big city in china.

a shanghai, like shanghai kelly, was contacted by someone in turn of the century san francisco when they were owed money by someone. usually, that amount was too large to be repaid. and usually, that amount was accumulated through whoring and gambling.

aaaaanyways, the debtee would contact the shanghai, who would find the debtor, knock him out, bind and gag him, and then drag him onto a boat, where he would sell him to the captain. he would then split the money with the debtee.

usually, the man would awaken as the boat was well out to sea, and he would be put to work immediately.

the boat's destination? shanghai.

you see, i don't just bring the funny. i bring the inane trivia.

also, shanghai kelly's is the rocky bleier of sports bars.
author: Steve T.

description:
i come here for two reasons...and it's unrelated to drinking.  the charming bartender with the irish accent and gregory the bouncer who reminds me of santa claus in his 40s.

i guess that wasn't a very helpful review.  ok drinks are cheapies and very low key.  just the way i like it.
author: Cindy N.

description:
Definitely a neighborhood bar.  There is nothing snooty  or fancy about this place.  Its always packed on the weekends, great staff and conveniently located.  Kelly's is a great place to either start your night or end it.
One piece of advise. Never order a New Castle there.  I'm not sure if its the kegs or the piping, but the New Castle always tastes crappy.
Other than that, Shanghai Kelly's is a great place!!
author: Travis E.

description: Meh is absolutely right....this place is definitely lacking in MANY areas....nasty/teensy bathrooms....oddly shaped... weird mix of sausagefest watching sports center, and trashy girls trying to get their attention. Also some annoying chick came in selling cigarettes and ish...unimpressed...it is really close...so maybe if i was already trashed i might finish my night here, but i would not stay here for a long time.
author: Jess V.

description: The two times I've been here it's way too crowded.  I'm sure it's a cool spot when it's more mellow, but standing around packed into a place like a sardine is not my idea of a good time.
author: Julie F.

description: Standard faux Irish pub with silly artwork and ironic signs.  Never any seating and the bartenders have always been less than pleasant.  It's a non smoking pub, but everyone who smokes just does so in the doorway, so the whole place stinks.  They might as well just let them smoke inside.  I'd only go back if everyone in a group voted on it.  Otherwise, I'll avoid it.
author: Sean M.

description: Fun place at any time, the quintessential neighborhood bar!! But, during a Steelers football game, you can't even make it through the door. I am there every Sunday watching the game on the big flat screen tv's drinking beer with other fans. No attitude, great bartenders, and a party hearty crowd...my kind of place!
author: Jason D.

description: Shanghai Kelly's is a bit of an institution -- amongst the small legion of Steeler fans in San Francisco, as well as those who want a laid back, unpretentious spot to get drunk with friends on a week night.  The bartenders are cool, you can play dice, and there's a good jukebox.
author: Andrew E.

description: Shanghai Kelly's is nothing special but it's a local joint for me. I had a quick drink their for Halloween but I've never been back...doesn't have much pull. It hasn't an awesome jukebox...guess I should take my own advice and try it out on a Fri or Sat night.
author: Cassy R.

description: Was here this weekend with some friends, and it was a good spot to hang out for a while to stay out of the rain.  I rediscovered an old college love for PBR, and while it was only $3.50 for a pint that still seemed a bit expensive for the stuff.  Bonus star for the bartender who, when we told him we were hungry, put a bowl of old-school Halloween candy in front of us.  Some Goobers, Oh Henry bars, and Raisinets tasted delicious!  Their HD televisions were great for those interested in the various sports games going on, but I couldn't care less.  Music was loud, but I could still carry on conversations with my friends.  A fun neighborhood spot.
author: Lindsay B.

description: This is the best bar in russian hill. Dave the bartender is amazing and so personable. Its like a copy of the shoe Cheers great friends converstaions and a lot of kindness is going around. They even have kelly events to help people who enjoy kellys connect. Its been my top hangout since day 1
author: K B.

description: I love this place.  This is the place you go if you want to drink and not be with a bunch of people watchers.  Their prices are reasonable and the music is exactly what you are looking for at a bar with with "dive" ambiance, i.e. classic rock to 80's.  If you need to grab a beer and aren't looking for the trendiest places, check it out.  You might find yourself having a better time than you expected.
author: Robert R.

description: Nice little saloon centrally located. i always see a crowd out there and can see it being a good place to catch a game. I attended their 26th anniversary and they provided some delicious bbq. i love that they have giant windows- perfect to watch the foot traffic and hub bub of that corner. Ladies if you are looking for an older man this is the place! Lots of good looking salt and peppered men there- my male friends did not like this place as much as me haha Their music was at a good level so everyone could still chat and cheer on their team.
author: Amber S.

description: Shanghai Kelly's is always full of drunk Irish men and I'll cheers to that.  They always have the game on and you don't have to push frat boys out of the way to see a tv like you do at greens.  I've always had a good time here but on one drunken night the bartender charged me $20 for two beers.  I guess there is a $20 minimum on credit cards but she should have told me that when I asked to close my $8 tab.  I guess I shouldn't complain though because other bartenders have given me free drinks on other occasions so it all evens out.
author: Jessica H.

description:
So i use to have a buddy that lived right next door from this place, so it was a usual thing to meet at the pad and get a few drinks in us, talk about what kind of trouble the night is going to lead to before heading downstairs for a few quick ones at SK. . . 

All i can say is i have been here during the daytime and its so much better.. its a decent bar, its been around a while... but come the weekend nights this place goes off, and I don't mean that in a good way either...
lets see maximum cap. must be at around 75 tops, *management* well we got a wide swinging door, lets let two hundred plus under-sexed overly aggressive popped collard wearing rejects squeeze in here, so much so you have to hold your breath to move, and heaven forbid you bring a friend of the female persuasion because they will be all over her, because its their entitlement as kings of douche to say hello and spit their best game.. 
Ahhh but you cant escape out of here because there is a constant tide of new guys pushing their way in... like i tide pool keeping you from swimming to safety....
but three stars because if you can beat the rush and come hang out its a really chill start to a day.
author: jamie z.

description:
you people are all high. this is one of the -very- worst bars in the city hands down. quite literally the epitome of a schmucky white fratboy 'drink til you puke' weekend hook up spot. the packs of dudes in their collared shirts (some with the tuck) looking around all night should give it away the second you walk in the place. 

gentrification sucks, man. the whole neighborhood should be carpetbombed if you ask me.
author: Justin H.

description: I was chillin mad deep with some bros and doing jagger bombs. All I can say is with that kind of hang over it must be good.
author: Gary B.

description: Best Steeler Bar in CA!  Yes I am a Steeler fan so I am biased but this is a really great bar anyways...  I love dive bars in general but this one has the best bartenders!  Great drinks!  Great place to watch a Steeler game...
author: Kris K.

description: Pretty much the definition of a "local neighborhood watering hole."  One weird thing is how the stools are really low and the bar is really tall.  You almost feel like a little kid since your beer is right at eye level.  Or maybe it was just me.
author: Peter R.

description:
infamous steelers bar in sf.  i'm sure it must have been crazy during this year's super bowl.

the bar gets really crowded, and it's hard to maneuver around -- just push your way through.  even though they get slammed, the bartenders serve your drinks with a smile.
author: Sheri N.

description: My first time going to this bar was really positive. There were two bartenders working on a Saturday night, and despite the large crowd of people, I found them to be extremely considerate and friendly. I also appreciated the fact that they tried to take orders and serve drinks as quickly as they could to accommodate the rush. Despite the narrow layout of the bar - which isn't exactly conducive to large crowds - I thought that it was fun and a nice place to go with friends that is fairly low-key and casual.
author: Whitney S.

description: Came for the US v Italy world cup game.  Decent TVs (4), bar manned by 1 very nice bartender (owner?) and holy crap!  The drafts are down-right dirt cheap.  Its like happy hour all the time!  I saw nothing wrong with this place...if youre ever looking for a place to drink at 10AM, you cant go wrong here...and its not too crowded.  No food, no frills.
author: Cathleya G.

description: If you're aching to feel like you're in college again or just want to get back in the "frat boy" groove, this is the place to go.
author: Bee H.

description: It's great for a dive bar.  Other then that, I could skip it.  I go once in a blue moon with some co-workers for a bitch session.
author: Noneya B.

description: No bullsh!t place to get your drink on and watching sports with a fun crowd....and the bartenders rock...plus they're great at weeding out the annoying Marina jock/bimbo crowd.
author: M G.

description: A great place to visit and mingle with the locals - especially if you are a steelers fan!  From Michigan and was treated really well by staff and patrons - inexpensive drink prices but no food.   The bartender Gregg made the night even better!  Definetly recommend if you are looking for cold beer and meeting new people!
author: Tracy S.

description:
I go to Kelly's regularly for football game watches and I couldn't ask for a better spot. 

The bartenders are always friendly and fast. The drinks are always tasty and fairly priced. Since they don't serve food, you can bring your own (which is good for the nearby Mexican and pizza joints). They even have game-day specials! The bar is kind of small, so it gets crowded quickly (especially when a themed bar-crawl comes through). But it's not a pretentious spot. The TVs are well placed but not overwhelming. 

I'm a bit partial to the environment and other patrons because they're all fans of my team. Mostly, anyway! Even the few that aren't are there for a good time and everyone seems to be a good-natured sports fan.
author: Chris C.

description: This is a bar that I just like having in my 'hood, even though I don't really go there that often.  I like the sign, I like stopping in for a beer, and I just like dive bars and the character they exude.
author: L C.

description: Seriously good jukebox (although they did move Black Betty over to Northstar, which is upsetting) and cheap drinks. You can bring food in too, which is great. Just a great place to hang out with friends.
author: Noelle Q.

description: It's not trying to be anything it's not. It's a fun place to go with some buddies, after you've had a few somewhere else. I've never had a bad time here, but haven't really had a spectacular night either. Just a really cool corner bar, good music, and the usual on tap.
author: Mike K.

description: Great bar to pre-party. Very old school culture. Cool dive bar with cool drinks. Check it out one time. I am not usually a big bar guy but this place got a good vibe no doubt.
author: Ed L.

description:
Hmmm.......ok, I'm going to be optimistic about this place. I feel I HAVE to be. I've been here a few times and for some reason can never feel comfy here. Maybe it's because no one wants to strike up a conversation with me (except the bartendress who had been nine days off cigs and felt inclined to tell me so when she enviously saw my pack). Maybe it's 'cause everyone else seems such a damn good mood and I'm not.  Maybe it's because they offer beer in two sizes (sometimes you have a day where committing to one big beer as opposed two medium sized beers seems like a challenge--oh who am I kidding? I might have commitment issues but certainly not with my beer!). Maybe it's because it's a place where people can go in the afternoon and not get funny looks. I really want to like this place. I really really do. It's like when you're going out without someone where you know you don't feel the sparks but you feel guilty breaking it off with that person because they're such a nice person........
Ok maybe I just have commitment issues.
author: Veronica G.

description:
i like this bar.  it's by far my favorite closest to my apt.  the bartenders are really nice.  the patrons are real laid back.  non of that marina nonsense.  it can get crowded.  but i tend to frequent at less busy times of the day.

oh and they love boston.  but you have to have a 20$ min on your cc.
author: jessie h.

description: Good bar for a beer.  It is one of those typical long and narrow bars, which are common in San Francisco, but annoying when you are trying to have a good time and get bumped by everyone in the bar as they make their way to the bathroom.  Four stars if you only expect a dive-ish bar out of the joint.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Nice low key bar with an awesome jukebox.  Grab a beer and sit in the window and enjoy the people watching down Polk. This place is great.  It may be my new favorite neighborhood spot!
author: Jaime C.

description:
order the bart simpson shot,
it's cheap and good, trust me
author: Scott K.

description: A great place to hit on a Sunday after over-staying your welcome at one of the many lovely brunch establishments on Polk.   The bartenders are hysterical, and the fact that there is a one-stall bathroom isn't a problem when there are only 8 patrons.
author: Amanda B.

description: Pretty slow service and it's a STEELERS bar. Bleh!!!!!! Maybe i'm slightly biased but oh well. Not very friendly bartenders either which is important in a place like that. I don't usually give one star, but I've been here 3 times on a Saturday night and never have I been impressed in the slightest.  Also pretty dive-y....
author: Courtney M.

description: This bar is great - the bartenders have only cut us off once. This place is a great hangout. I'd highly recommend it for those who are out for a anti-club, more bar-ish experience.
author: Dan M.

description: Despite lurking Polk Gulch constantly when I lived nearby, I always skipped past this place when I would go bar hopping.  And good thing, too, because the place kindof sucks.  Yes, they give you pretty strong drinks that are reasonably priced, but so do plenty of other places along Polk.  Skip this place and go visit Bigfoot at his eponymous lodge.
author: Helen C.

description: Want to get hammered? This hole-in-the-wall dive bar is the place to do it... period.
author: Dave L.

description: I nice neighborhood dive bar.  The serve alcohol to drink, which is nice and they have a bathroom and it is fun.  These are the types of things people should be looking for in this kind of bar.  Don't slam them because their stools are too low.  If that is what you notice at a place like this then you are missing the point.
author: Michael N.

description: Kelly's has the best bus trips and Booze cruises! If they have one get on it it doesn't matter where it's  going.  If Shanghai Kelly's was a person they could have fun in a phone booth withcout a quarter!
author: Tommy W.

description: If you want a taste of an old sf bar, then you have to come here. Its definitely a locals hole in the wall. Juke box is still top notch. Booze only, no food.
author: Not M.

description: An old favorite place of mine. Always a great place to grab a beer, sometimes too overloaded with dudes (but that's quite a common theme for bars in this neck of the woods)...
author: michaela w.

description: Kelly's is the only bar in the city where I would even come close to considering myself a regular. It's a great little piece of SF history, and a comfy and fun place to hang out on Friday nights or to watch the big game it. It's small so it can get very crowded, but that's part of the  fun. The crowd is friendly & casual-always some great drunken conversation to be had. The best part though, is the dynamic duo behind the bar! Heather & Brian are without a doubt my most favorite of favorite bartenders in all of San Francisco! They'll treat you right on a Friday night. You'll probably fall in love with both of them, in which case you might consider catching their Saturday night shift at the North Star as well. Cheers!
author: Sara W.

description: Small place, but it's got a lot of charm with it's eclectic decor and saloon feel.  Good for drinks, but you might encounter a lot of random weird folks.
author: Naomi N.

description: What you see is what you get. A prime Steelers hangout and the walls are covered with interesting photos and inside jokes that are funny even to the most clueless patron. Great place to spend New Years Day!
author: Tabor, S.

description: Shanghai Kelly's is my home on Sunday mornings...the Steelers fans are amazing and Greg is the best bartender ever! :)
author: Tovah L.

description: If you're looking for an unpretentious place, with lots of character and great bartenders, look no further!! A great place to grab a beer while eating a slice of pizza or a taco. Better yet, just sit and read the hysterical wall commentary. Oh yeah, they've got a solid juke box.
author: Jason A.

description: I was in San Francisco in March 2008 visiting a good friend of mine and this is the bar we ended up at a couple of times. I had a great time at this bar. It has good service, a good jukebox and good people. It was kind of crowded at times but that means nothing due to the fact that one of the times I was there was St. Patrick's day. All around it is a great place to grab a beer as it is right across the street from a great taco place. I recommend it to anyone who enjoys a beer and a chill atmosphere in the heart of one of the best cities in the world.
author: Thomas G.

description: Decent crowd. Place is a bit small so it got pretty packed when I was there. Friends had some vodka tonics that were mostly tonic as well. Weird decor inside, you see some pretty random things.
author: Mike C.

description: I quite enjoy this bar.  Just a small, simple bar room with sports on TV and good prices on drinks.  Most recently I was there with my girlfriend on a quiet Thursday afternoon for a few hours, the bartender was a really friendly guy (and a fellow Boston native) and comped us about half of our drinks for reasons I don't really know, but he got himself a nice tip as a result.
author: P. G.

description: It is a locals bar.  Fun to watch games in and fun to go with a friend to chill out.  It does get a little too crowded at night and wicked loud.  Bartenders are awesome and so are the bouncers!
author: Brianna R.

description: i love this bar. i am there often, and i have never had one mediocre experience. the atmosphere is friendly and relaxed, the bartenders are attentive. overall, i'm goint to keep coming here, and any bar fan should have knowledge of this location.
author: Sami B.

description: This is just a great bar for a night on the town or a weekend afternoon. The bartenders are super cool, and there is always some great music playing.  I've never had a bad time here, and you won't go broke either.
author: Steve L.

description: my Ex swears this is one of the best bars in SF... but that's really not saying much. i think this bar is popular among the "restaurant industry" crowd. i went here last year and was not impressed at all. in fact, i was down-right bored... but maybe thats just because i was there with my Ex.
author: Michelle I.

description: Once Daire returns from his southern hemisphere adventures, I will return to Shanghai Kelly's; unfortunately, the regulars (the ones who make themselves toilet paper crowns, wear Kelly's baby-Ts depite their taller-than-6'-stature, and put bar stools over their heads) aren't compelling enough a draw.
author: Hannah J.

description: LOVE to watch Boston College football games here! and i like that you can bring your own food in. and the beer is cheap! YUM!
author: Whitnie L.

description:
the bartendars are good but this place isnt the greatest when its crowded since is so narrow and small.

good place to start the night i guess or if you just want to have a kick back night on a weekday
author: Anson T.

description: i must have walked by this place a hundred times before i ever stepped through the threshold. like when you know you are inevitably going to do something full-fledged so you don't feel the need to rush into it. anyways, it was like breaking my seal the first time i went there. it's the kind of bar that makes beer go down like gatorade in a desert.  I prefer it on week nights when it is practically empty save for the kitsch on the walls and the random irish guys who flock there. on weekends this place can get packed though, and it will take about fifteen minutes to walk the length of the bar. beware of the mirror against the back wall, it always looks deceivingly like a doorway to more fun.
author: julia r.

description:
being from pittsburgh and having a roommate named kelly (the names have been altered for security purposes), i'm practically legally bound to like this place. however, i could be from indiana with a roommate named jane and feel just the same.

such a homey atmosphere and always a great crowd. the bartenders are always ready to chat, especially if you flash a pittsburgh grin (meaning, you have to have a few gold teeth).
author: Julia D.

description: Great old school neighborhood bar.  Very friendly bartenders, and a lot of great locals who just want to hang out, have a beer or a few with friends, and watch sports.  If you are a Steelers fan, this is the best bar in the city for you.
author: Grace R.

description: It's freakin hot in this place, and the crowd somehow manages to be Marina-ish. It's small, crowded, but 3 stars for the cheap booze.
author: Jenna F.

description: this place is perfect any time of the day - for a quiet happy hour, giants game, or fun night out.  the bartenders are awesome and it's a perfect local spot.  cheap, stiff drinks and good jukebox.  get some dice and sit at the front table to play 7-14-21.
author: B H.

description: I used to live right across the street from Kelly's.  Everytime I would have a great time.  They always have some crazy shot you can order that is usually super cheap.  I've ordered the "Bart Simpson" shot which is Pineapple Juice/Vodka, so I haven't yet decided if the name is due to the spikey hair or color, but regardless a $2 shot is good regardless.  I've also purchased plenty of Obama's Koolaid shots for $3.  The bartenders are social and very nice.
author: Tyke L.

description: this place was packed, seemed like a great neighborhood joint, too bad i didn't know anyone.  i forgot to mention that when my friend went to the men's room, a drunk chick was talking on her cellphone and taking a shit with the stall door open.
author: Richard Y.

description: Great place to stop and have a beer on the way home any night of the week. Good bartenders.
author: Sarah R.
